properties.title: Mrs. Sim Horm Village Bank Group : Cambodia
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=574674" align="left" alt="photo" title="Mrs. Sim Horm Village Bank Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$2,500 of $2,850 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Seventeen people who live in Kdol village in Takeo province make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Sim Horm, who is 49 years old, is the village bank president, selected by the other members. The members will use their portion of the loan in varied ways to improve their businesses. Mrs. Sim Horm owns a general store in the local village where she sells groceries to earn a large profit to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Touch Ouch, is a farmer who owns a one-hectare (2.5-acre) plot of land that he uses to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Sim Horm wants to expand it. So, to achieve this purpose, she is seeking a loan to buy more groceries to sell. Mrs. Sim Horm is the mother of three children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, another is a fisherman, and the other is studying in the local school. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Mrs. Sokha Meas Village Bank Group : Cambodia
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=574680" align="left" alt="photo" title="Mrs. Sokha Meas Village Bank Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$2,600 of $2,875 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> In Kdol village, Takeo province, sixteen people make up this village bank loan. They have selected Mrs. Sokha Meas, who was born in 1961, as the village bank president. The members will use their portions of the loan in varied ways to support their businesses. Mrs. Sokha Meas is a farmer who owns a half-hectare (1.25-acre) plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Vannat Chea, is a cow middleman. Since her husband’s business is going well Mrs. Sokha Meas wants to expand it. So, to improve this business, she is applying for a loan to enable him to buy more cows to sell. Mrs. Sokha Meas is the mother of three children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the others are attending the local public school. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Mr. Nuon Touch Village Bank Group : Cambodia
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=574798" align="left" alt="photo" title="Mr. Nuon Touch Village Bank Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$1,375 of $1,825 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> This village bank loan consists of seventeen people who live in Sameakki village in Takeo province. Mr. Nuon Touch, who was born in 1949, is the village bank president. He was selected for this role by the other members, who will use their portions of the loan for varied purposes. Mr. Nuon Touch and his wife, Mrs. Tol Boeng, are farmers who own a two-hectare plot of land on which they cultivate rice to sell to support their family. They have three children, one of whom arranges funerals, while the others are studying in a local public school. Since his child’s funeral business is going well he wants to expand it. So to help his child reach this goal, Mr. Nuon Touch is asking for a loan to buy funeral fireworks for resale. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Mrs. Veth Torn Village Bank Group : Cambodia
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=574812" align="left" alt="photo" title="Mrs. Veth Torn Village Bank Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$1,350 of $1,575 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> This village bank loan consists of thirteen people who live in Sameakki village in Takeo province. Mrs. Veth Torn, 36, is the village bank president. She was selected for this role by the other members, who will use their portions of the loan for varied purposes. Mrs. Veth Torn is a mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in local public school, while the youngest is five years old. She works at her home as a pig breeder while her husband, Mr. Sokly Loem, is a fisherman, and also owns a threshing machine. Since her pig-raising is going well she wants to expand her businees. So to reach this goal, Mrs.Veth Torn is seeking a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Tesorito De Oro - Ocongate Group : Peru
properties.description:
<p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=591109" align="left" alt="photo" title="Tesorito De Oro - Ocongate Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$4,650 of $4,825 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> The members belong to the “Tesorito de Oro – Ocongate” communal bank. They live in the district of Ocongate, which belongs to the province of Quispicanchis, Cusco department. Mariza is 27 years old, is from Ocongate, and lives with her husband. Her husband is a mechanic and he sells lubricants for cars. She has 2 children who are studying in the public school in Ocongate. She alternates her household activities with raising small livestock. She buys small animals (guinea pigs, domestic fowl, pigs), fattens them, and sells them. She is requesting a loan to buy small animals and expand her business so she can have more income. The other members work in different businesses, such as small grocery stores, crafts, agriculture, cattle raising, clothing sales, floristry, taxis, cheese sales, and antiques sales. The members value and are infinitely grateful for the loan granted to them since it will allow them to grow and improve their businesses, and thereby improve their quality of life. They promise to make their payments in the stipulated time frame.
<br /><p><strong>Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer</strong></p>  <br clear="all">

properties.title: Mrs. Phalla Oem Village Bank Group : Cambodia
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=576530" align="left" alt="photo" title="Mrs. Phalla Oem Village Bank Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$2,750 of $3,350 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> This village bank loan consists of twenty people who live in Svay Pang Ankrang village in Kandal province. Mrs. Phalla Oem, 35, is the village bank president. She was selected for this role by the other members, who will use their portions of the loan to support their different businesses. Mrs. Phalla Oem and her husband, Mr. Ra Tith, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate leeks and bananas. The couple have four children; three are farmers and the other is a fruit seller in the local market. They work very hard to support their family. They will use the requested loan from AMK to buy fertilizer for their farm. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Chanthou Saem's Group : Cambodia
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=576556" align="left" alt="photo" title="Chanthou Saem's Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$825 of $975 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> This village loan is made up of six members who live in Preak Snay village, Kandal province. Mrs. Phal Chuon is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. Each member of this group will use his or her portion of the loan to support a different business. <br>Mrs. Phal Chuon is a farmer who owns one hectare of land to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, she is also a fish seller in the local market. She will use her loan from Kiva partner, AMK, to buy more fish to sell. From both her businesses, Mrs. Phal Chuon is able to earn a small income to support her family. Mrs. Phal Chuon is a widow with two children, who are both seamstresses in a garment factory. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Hoang Chuon's Group : Cambodia
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=576576" align="left" alt="photo" title="Hoang Chuon's Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$850 of $875 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> This group loan consists of five people who are located in Pouthi Reamea village, Kandal province. Mrs. Hoang Chuon is the group leader of the loan, having been selected by its five members. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their particular business. Mrs. Hoang Chuon is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to cultivate peanuts for a living. Her husband, Mr. Tot San, is a vehicle-driving laborer. With both of these occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. In order to increase her income to improve their family living, Mrs. Hoang Chuon will use this loan from AMK to buy a fishing machine and a fishing boat for her new business. This couple has four children: three are seamstresses in the garment factory while the other one is attending the local school. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Srom Maong's Group : Cambodia
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=576603" align="left" alt="photo" title="Srom Maong's Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$1,775 of $1,900 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Fourteen people comprise this village loan located in Prek Raing village, Kandal Province and led by Mrs. Srom Maong, 33, the village bank president selected by the members. Each group member will use their portion of the loan to support their various businesses. Srom is a Khmer cake seller in the local market while her husband, Mr. Thy Tuy, is a fisherman, both occupations providing a small income that allows them to support their family. They have three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the other, age 3, is not yet in school. In order to support her husband's fishing business, Srom is requesting a loan from AMK to buy a fishing machine. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Thy Muong's Group : Cambodia
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=576630" align="left" alt="photo" title="Thy Muong's Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$450 of $500 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Mr. Thy Muong, 53, is the leader of this group loan, having been selected by its four members who are located in Roluos village, Kandal province. The members will use their portion of the loan to buy equipment, supplies and other items for their individual purposes. Mr. Thy Muong is a farmer who owns a plot of land that he uses to cultivate rice for a living. For this farm, he will use the loan from AMK/Kiva to buy fertilizer to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Soeun Toem, is a seamstress in a garment factory and with both of these occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. This couple has four children: two are seamstresses in the garment factory and the other two are students in the local school. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Mith Soam's Group : Cambodia
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=576633" align="left" alt="photo" title="Mith Soam's Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$375 of $575 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Mrs. Mith Soam, age 52, is the leader of this loan group, having been selected by its five members who are located in Bat Lvea village, Kandal province. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their own business. Mrs. Mith Soam is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice and she works very hard to support her two children. In order to increase her income to improve the family living, she will use the loan from AMK/Kiva to buy a cow for breeding. Mrs. Mith Soam is widow with two children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory and other is a laborer for the OMC company. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Sophon Chum's Group : Cambodia
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=576658" align="left" alt="photo" title="Sophon Chum's Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$1,225 of $2,250 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> This village bank loan is made up of 14 villagers from Chrouy Pisei village in Kandal province. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses. Mrs. Sophon Chum, 40, has been selected as the village bank president by the other members. She is a farmer who owns one hectare of land for cultivating rice. She will use the loan to buy a grass-cutting machine for cutting vegetation on her farm. Aside from being a farmer, she also sews clothes for sale, while her husband, Mr. Sambok Kong, is a teacher in the local school. With their occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. The couple has six children; two are at home and support their mother farming, while the other four are students in the local school. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Mrs. Loeng Mam Village Bank Group : Cambodia
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=577228" align="left" alt="photo" title="Mrs. Loeng Mam Village Bank Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$2,325 of $2,525 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> This village bank loan group consists of twenty-two people located in Roka village, Takeo province. They have selected Mrs. Loeng Mam, who was born in 1965, as the village bank president. All the members will use their portion of loan in varied ways to support their businesses. Mrs. Loeng Mam is a farmer who owns a 1.8-hectare (4.5-acre) plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Vuth Set, is a motorbike taxi driver. Mrs. Loeng Mam’s problem is that her field has infertile soil, and she does not have enough money to farm it. So, to improve her rice production, she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan she will rent a plowing machine to plow her field. Mrs. Loeng Mam is the mother of six children, three of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the others are studying in the local school. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Mrs. Sokim Sou Village Bank Group : Cambodia
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=577236" align="left" alt="photo" title="Mrs. Sokim Sou Village Bank Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$1,550 of $1,925 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> This village bank loan group has fifteen members who live in Trapeang Reang village, Takeo province. Mrs. Sokim Sou, who was born in 1969, is the village bank president having been selected by the other members. The members will use their portion of the loan in varied ways to support their businesses. Mrs. Sokim Sou and her husband, Mr. Thol Tuon, are farmers who own a half-hectare (1.25-acre) plot of land that they use to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Moreover, Mrs. Sokim Sou is also a pig breeder. Mrs. Sokim Sou’s problem is that her field is far away from the irrigation system. So, to solve this problem, she is seeking a loan to dig a well. With the rest of the loan, she will buy pig feed. Mrs. Sokim Sou is the mother of two children, one of whom is studying in the local school, while the youngest one is five years old. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Mrs. Seng Ung Village Bank Group : Cambodia
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=577240" align="left" alt="photo" title="Mrs. Seng Ung Village Bank Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$1,275 of $1,375 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> In Champa village, Takeo province, these fifteen people make up this village bank loan group. Mrs. Seng Ung, who is 55 years old, is the village bank president, having been selected by the other members. The members will use their portion of the loan in varied ways to support their businesses. Mrs. Seng Ung is a farmer who owns a half-hectare (1.25-acre) plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. She has a problem because her field has infertile soil, but she does not have enough money to support it. So, to improve her rice production, she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. Mrs. Seng Ung is a widow with four children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while another one is a construction worker, and the other one is attending the local school. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Mrs. Chi Mao Village Bank Group : Cambodia
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=577244" align="left" alt="photo" title="Mrs. Chi Mao Village Bank Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$875 of $2,425 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> These nineteen people, who live in Prey Prum village, Takeo province, make up this village bank loan group. Mrs. Chi Mao, who was born in 1947, is the village bank president having been selected by the other members. The members will each use their portion of the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Chi Mao and her husband, Mr. Bam Sek, are farmers who own a half-hectare (1.25-acre) plot of land that they use to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Her husband is also a furniture maker. Mrs. Chi Mao has a problem because her field has infertile soil. So, to improve her rice production, she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. She is the mother of a child who is a student in the local school. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Mrs. Ken Sum Village Bank Group : Cambodia
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=577246" align="left" alt="photo" title="Mrs. Ken Sum Village Bank Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$1,125 of $1,375 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> This village bank loan group consists of thirteen people who live Sameakki village, Takeo province. Mrs. Ken Sum, who was born in 1985, is the village bank president, having been selected by the other members. The members will use their portions of loan in varied ways to support their businesses. Mrs. Ken Sum is a farmer who owns a small piece of land that she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Moreover, she is also a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Saren Kong, is a laborer. Since her pig breeding is going well Mrs. Ken Sum wants to expand it. So, to achieve this goal, she is applying for a loan to buy more piglets to raise. Mrs. Ken Sum is the mother of two children who are both too young to work or study. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Chanthou Chann's Group : Cambodia
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=577272" align="left" alt="photo" title="Chanthou Chann's Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$225 of $975 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Six people selected Mrs. Chanthou Chann as this group's leader. She was born in 1965. The group is located in Chonloat Dai village, Takeo province. All the members are requesting a group loan and they will use their portions of the loan in varied ways to support their businesses in the current year. Mrs. Chanthou Chann is a tailor at her home and this allows her to earn some money to support her family. She is also a dessert seller and her husband, Mr. La Luy, is a construction worker. They try to work hard but they can only earn a little money. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Chanthou Chann is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. She is a mother of two children who all both studying in school. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Mr. Chhiek Tien Village Bank Group : Cambodia
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=577342" align="left" alt="photo" title="Mr. Chhiek Tien Village Bank Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$100 of $1,625 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Eleven people are requesting this village bank loan and they are all villagers in Tuek Thla village, Takeo province. Mr. Chhiek Tien is the village bank president. He is 38 years old and was selected by the other members who will use their portions of the loan for different ways to support their businesses. He is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where he cultivates rice to sell in order to support his family. He is also a string maker and his wife, Mrs. Chet Heng, is a seamstress in a garment factor. They try to work a lot but they still can only earn a little money to support their family. So to improve his family's living, Mr. Chhiek Tien is requesting a loan to buy some chicken and piglets for breeding to start a new business. He is a father of two children, both of whom are too young to work or study. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Mrs. Mom Nol Village Bank Group : Cambodia
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=577363" align="left" alt="photo" title="Mrs. Mom Nol Village Bank Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$825 of $975 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> These twelve people have selected Mrs. Mom Nol as the village bank president. She is 35 years old. All the members make up a village bank loan located in Trapeang Chhuk village, Takeo province, and they will each use their portion of the loan for varied purposes. Mrs. Mom Nol is a widow with three children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the youngest one is five years old. She works as a farmer who owns a very small piece of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support her family. Her problem is that her field has infertile soil, so to increase rice yield in this current year, Mrs. Mom Nol is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer. She plans to use the rest of the loan to pay farm laborers to help her to do farming. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Mrs. Saro Sao Village Bank Group : Cambodia
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=578102" align="left" alt="photo" title="Mrs. Saro Sao Village Bank Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$1,825 of $2,175 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> This village bank consists of thirteen people from Chonloat Dai village, Takeo province. Each member will use their portion of the loan in various ways to support their businesses. Mrs. Saro Sao is the village bank president selected by the other members. Mrs. Saro Sao, age 30, and her husband, Mr. Thorn Sok, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. In addition, Mr. Thorn Sok is a driver. This couple tries to work hard, but still, they earn very little money. To improve things, Mrs. Saro Sao is seeking a loan to buy a cow for breeding, to start a new business. She is the mother of a child who is three years old. Mrs. Noem Seng is the group guarantor, so she is present in the picture. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Mrs. Ry Yin Village Bank Group : Cambodia
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=578110" align="left" alt="photo" title="Mrs. Ry Yin Village Bank Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$2,725 of $3,025 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> This village bank loan has nineteen people who live in Chonloat Dai village, Takeo province. All members will use their portion of their loan for different purposes. Mrs. Ry Yin, who was born in 1957, is the village bank president who was selected by the other members. She and her husband, Mr. Kuck Sek, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Her husband is also a stock broker in a private company. Though they try to work hard they can earn only a little money. So to improve her family's living, Mrs. Ry Yin is applying for a loan start a new business. She will purchase some piglets for breeding and pig food. She is the mother of five children, one of whom is a stock broker, another one is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the others are attending school. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Mrs. Seng Um Village Bank Group : Cambodia
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=578113" align="left" alt="photo" title="Mrs. Seng Um Village Bank Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$3,375 of $3,750 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Twenty-one people have selected Mrs. Seng Um as village bank president. They live in Chonloat Dai village, Takeo province, and they will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Seng Um, who was born in 1969, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she grows rice to support her family. She is also a silk tier for weaving, while her husband, Mr. Seng Hort Bun, is a rock breaker and a construction worker. Now she wants to breed pigs, but she does not have enough money. To solve this problem, Mrs. Seng Um is seeking a loan to buy some piglets and pig feed to start a new business. She is the mother of four children: one is a driver while the others are enrolled in school. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Mrs. Sem Ea Village Bank Group : Cambodia
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=578129" align="left" alt="photo" title="Mrs. Sem Ea Village Bank Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$425 of $2,150 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Mrs. Sem Ea is the village bank president selected by 14 people located in Trapeang Reang village, Takeo province. All the members make up the village bank and they will use their portion of the loan for various goals. Mrs. Sem Ea, who was born in 1970, is a rice middleman and a pig breeder, who is able to earn a large profit to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Khum Samret, is a rice wine maker from home. Since her husband’s business is going well, she wants to expand it. To improve this business, Mrs. Sem Ea is seeking a loan to buy more rice to make rice wine to sell. She is the mother of five children: one is a laborer, one is a seamstress in garment factory, another one helps the father to make rice wine, another one is studying in school, and the youngest one is two years old. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Mrs. Touch Sam Village Bank Group : Cambodia
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=578548" align="left" alt="photo" title="Mrs. Touch Sam Village Bank Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$825 of $2,500 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> This village bank loan has seventeen people who have selected Mrs. Touch Sam as a village bank president. Mrs. Sam was born in 1963 and is located in Chrouy village, Takeo province. Each member of the group will use their portion of the loan in various ways to increase their income for this current year. Mrs. Touch Sam is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. She is also a Khmer cake seller, door-to-door. She is a widow with a child who is a laborer. She tries to work a lot but she earns very little to support her family's living costs. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Touch Sam is seeking for a loan to buy three piglets for breeding to start a new business. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Orlando Jesús Galán Flores : Nicaragua
properties.description:
<p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=578951" align="left" alt="photo" title="Orlando Jes&#xfa;s Gal&#xe1;n Flores" border="1"/>   </a><b>$950 of $1,175 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Orlando Jesús Galán Flores is 37 years old and lives in the Francia neighborhood. He is married and his wife works as a merchant, generating income and helping to cover the household expenses. They have three teen-aged children and all of them attend school. The gentleman is a farmer and they have more than ten years experience with this activity. He was able to obtain his farm, with his parents’ help, and he now raises his crops there. He would like to invest in farm supplies so that he can have a better harvest. This economic support will allow him to have better results with his business and will help to provide better economic conditions for his family. As parents, this will also allow them to have the financial resources to invest in their children’s university education.
<br /><p><strong>Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer</strong></p>  <br clear="all">

properties.title: Luis Alberto Cruz Enderica : Ecuador
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=579520" align="left" alt="photo" title="Luis Alberto Cruz Enderica" border="1"/>   </a><b>$600 of $800 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Luis Alberto Cruz Enderica is 30 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in the Ventanas province in Los Ríos. He has one son, Gabriel, 8. Luis is a member of the rural communal bank 'Valle Alto' (High Valley), which is located in the Voluntad de Dios precinct, 1.5 hours from Ventanas. There are 23 members in the group in total, and the majority work in agriculture. This is the second loan they are seeking from Cooperativa San José. Luis works in agriculture, growing maize and rice. He makes his purchases each month in Ventanas city and sells in the same location. He is seeking this loan to invest in the purchase of maize and rice, and thinks that the loan is an opportunity to improve his situation. His dreams are to have money to purchase a plot of land. In the way of his dreams are the plagues and diseases that affect his crops, such as the cogollero worm. Luis likes to play soccer on the weekends. <br /><p><strong>Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer</strong></p>  <br clear="all">

properties.title: Victor Manuel Andogama Arguello : Ecuador
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=579535" align="left" alt="photo" title="Victor Manuel Andogama Arguello" border="1"/>   </a><b>$575 of $800 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Victor Manuel Andogama Arguello is 37 years old. He is single and lives with his two daughters Katerin and Monica. He lives in Ventanas in the province of Los Rios. Victor is a partner in the Valle Alto rural bank, which is located in Recinto Voluntad de Dios an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 23 partners in all, most of whom work in agriculture. This will be their second loan with the San Jose Cooperative. Victor is a farmer, and he grows rice and beans. He makes his purchase every month in the Peña Store in the city of Ventanas; he sells his produce to the same shop. He is applying for the loan to purchase rice and bean seeds. He believes that the loan is an opportnity to improve his life. HIs dreams are to purchase a car and open a business in Ventanas. His business faces challenges, primarily infestations and plant diseases. He enjoys playing sports. <br /><p><strong>Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer</strong></p>  <br clear="all">

properties.title: Edy Patricio Zurita Verdesoto : Ecuador
properties.description:
<p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=579903" align="left" alt="photo" title="Edy Patricio Zurita Verdesoto" border="1"/>   </a><b>$450 of $800 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Edy Patricio Zurita Verdesoto is 35 years old. He has a common-law marriage and lives with his children in Ventanas, which is in Los Ríos province. He has 2 children, Wendy (3) and Elkin (11 months). Edy is a member of the “Valle Alto” (High Valley) solidarity group, which is located in the Voluntad de Dios precinct, one and one-half hours from Ventanas. There are 23 members altogether, most of them farmers. This is the second loan they have taken out with Cooperativa San José. Edy is a farmer who grows rice, corn and tomatoes. He makes his purchases every month in the city of Ventanas, at Fertisa [an agricultural supply vendor] and at the Peña market, and he sells his products at the same place. He is asking for the loan to invest in buying seeds for rice, corn and tomatoes. He thinks the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dreams are to buy a house and to look for the best education for his children. He faces challenges like pests. He likes to play sports.
<br /><p><strong>Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer</strong></p>  <br clear="all">

properties.title: Luis Bernardo Muñoz Muñoz : Ecuador
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=579912" align="left" alt="photo" title="Luis Bernardo Mu&#xf1;oz Mu&#xf1;oz" border="1"/>   </a><b>$475 of $600 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Luis is 23 years old and lives with his partner in the village of Ventanas in the province of Los Rios. He has a son named Leonel. Luis is a member of the Narcisa de Jesús community bank. There are 15 members total, the majority of whom make a living in agriculture, like Luis, who harvests corn and cocoa. He buys and sells his products in Ventanas. He is requesting the loan to plant corn. The loan will help him purchase supplies for his crops. His dream is to purchase his own land and have a home for his family. He enjoys playing indoor soccer.<br /><p><strong>Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer</strong></p>  <br clear="all">

properties.title: Joel Eliceo Castro Vite : Ecuador
properties.description:
<p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=580535" align="left" alt="photo" title="Joel Eliceo Castro Vite" border="1"/>   </a><b>$300 of $600 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Joel Eliceo Castro Vite, 19, is single and lives with his parents in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Rios. Joel is a member of the Lucha Para Triunfar ("Struggle To Triumph") community bank. Most of the group's 13 members are farmers. Joel, on the other hand, is a merchant. He buys and sells products in Ventanas. He is applying for a loan to stock his business. His dream is to continue working and caring for his family. Joel likes sports, including football and boli.
<br /><p><strong>Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer</strong></p>  <br clear="all">

properties.title: Santiago Desiderio Aviles Munoz : Ecuador
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=580549" align="left" alt="photo" title="Santiago Desiderio Aviles Munoz" border="1"/>   </a><b>$775 of $800 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Santiago Desiderio Aviles Munoz is 50 years old. He lives with a woman in the Ventanas canton in the Los Rios province. He has 2 children who are 4 and 6 years old. Santiago is a member of the rural bank San Francisco de Sibimbe. There are 13 members in total, and most of them work in agriculture. Santiago works in agriculture and he grows cacao. He buys and sells his products in Ventanas. He is asking for the loan for cacao crops. With the support of this loan he will improve the quality of his products. His dream is to advance in agriculture and not stay in the same place. He likes to fish in his spare time. <br /><p><strong>Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer</strong></p>  <br clear="all">

properties.title: Alba Lidia Izaguirre Betanco : Nicaragua
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=582062" align="left" alt="photo" title="Alba Lidia Izaguirre Betanco" border="1"/>   </a><b>$1,125 of $1,175 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Doña Alba Lidia is 48 years old and is married. Only her two youngest children depend on her economically, they study and support her with the household chores in their spare hours. Alba has worked as a primary school teacher in the Deyling Olivas de Nueva Guinea school. Alba is seeking her 7th loan to purchase construction materials and build a room in her house so her beautiful family can be more comfortable. Alba Lidia is characterised by her hard-working nature and is greatly loved by her neighbours and parents of her students. Her biggest dream is that her students can study and become good people in the future. <br /><p><strong>Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer</strong></p>  <br clear="all">

properties.title: Miguel Angel Lopez Contreras : Nicaragua
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=582065" align="left" alt="photo" title="Miguel Angel Lopez Contreras" border="1"/>   </a><b>$775 of $850 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Don Miguel Angel, 39, is married and lives in zone 5 in Nueva Guinea together with his family, composed of his wife and 3 children - 16, 13 and 7 years of age. The three children study and Miguel's wife takes care of the household chores and looks after their children. Miguel works as a juice and soft drink distributor to different grocery stores in his urban zone and the suburbs of Nueva Guinea. He has his own inventory and a truck for him to distribute the products. He obtains additional earnings from the taxi he owns. Miguel is seeking his first loan to invest in constructing a room for his older son to provide greater comfort to his family and so his son has privacy. Miguel's biggest dream in life is to see his children study and become good men, and not lack anything basic in his home. Miguel is well known in his zone for being a sociable and hard-working man. <br /><p><strong>Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer</strong></p>  <br clear="all">

properties.title: Anonymous : Lebanon
properties.description:
<p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=584655" align="left" alt="photo" title="Anonymous" border="1"/>   </a><b>$1,375 of $1,500 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 6, 2010 <br/> <br/> This Kiva borrower is a 21-year-old single man living with his parents and three siblings. He has four years of experience working as a car blacksmith. He is a relatively new business owner; he has been running his own shop since 2007. He is specialized in repairing car bodies. He works independently in his business. With his business income, he supports his father, in collaboration with his brother, with the family expenses. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve his business. This will be his second loan and he is asking for a bigger amount because he said that such amount will meet his project needs for the coming year. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profits by 15%. Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers. About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese microfinance sector since 1999. Originally a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in microfinance. At Ameen s.a.l., we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes. Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115 </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Ibrahim : Lebanon
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=599647" align="left" alt="photo" title="Ibrahim" border="1"/>   </a><b>$750 of $1,500 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 14, 2010 <br/> <br/> Ibrahim is a 45 years old married man father of four children, living in Chtaura Lebanon; He has been an owner of a spare parts shop since 1985. This is a very well known business in Chtaura as most of its population work in the automobile business. Ibrahim buys old cars or others that were sold after an accident, in order to be dismantled into useful parts, to be sold as spare parts. In addition to used spare parts, Ibrahim sells new spare parts too, which is a positive point for him among competitors. His clients can be anyone with a car problem and also other mechanics who buy his new and used spare parts.. This is the first time Ibrahim has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy more new and used spare parts that will help expand his business. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Mario Ruben Naranjo Vargas : Ecuador
properties.description:
<p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=586334" align="left" alt="photo" title="Mario Ruben Naranjo Vargas" border="1"/>   </a><b>$950 of $1,000 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Mario Ruben Naranjo Vargas is 30 years old. He lives in a common-law marrige in the canton of Chillanes in the Bolivar province. He has three children, ages 6, 3, and 2. Mario is a member of the San Jacinto community bank. There are 15 members in all, and the majority work in agriculture. Mario works in agriculture. He earns 140 dollars a month. He makes purchases and sells his products in Matilde. He is applying for the loan to invest in cocoa farming. The loan will help him advance his business. His dream is to have a house, a car, and a piece of land. His greatest challenge is when the cocoa freezes. He likes to play sports like volleyball and football. His favorite custom in his canton is the fiestas in the Val Paraíso. precinct.
<br /><p><strong>Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer</strong></p>  <br clear="all">

properties.title: Maurillo Marin Naranjo Vargas : Ecuador
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=586361" align="left" alt="photo" title="Maurillo Marin Naranjo Vargas" border="1"/>   </a><b>$775 of $1,000 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Maurillo Marin Naranjo Vargas is 45 years old. He lives in common law marriage in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador. He has 5 children, ages 17, 11, 9, 7, and 3. Maurillo is a member of the rural loan group San Jacinto. There are 15 members total, the majority of which work in the agricultural sector. Maurillo works in the agricultural sector. He earns on average $150 per month. He buys and sells his agricultural supplies and products in the nearby town of Matilde. Marillo plans to use the loan to build a house. His dream is to own a car and finish building the house. In his free time he likes to watch television and listen to music. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Armando Mesias Alarcon Cadena : Ecuador
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=586365" align="left" alt="photo" title="Armando Mesias Alarcon Cadena" border="1"/>   </a><b>$775 of $1,000 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Armando Mesias Alarcon Cadena is 42 years old. He is married and lives in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador. He has one son named Luis who is 12 years old. Armado is a member of the rural loan group called San Jacinto. There are a total of fifteen members in the group, the majority of whom work in the agricultural sector. Armando also works in the agricultural sector and earns on average of $130 per month. He buys and sells his products in the nearby town of Matilde. Armando plans to use the loan to grow cacao (used to make chocolate). He hopes to buy two plots of land. The climate this year has been hard on his crops. In his free time, Armando likes to play sports like volleyball and indoor soccer. His favorite community tradition is the fiesta of San Francisco, Ecuador. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Vicente Adalberto Sisa Naranjo : Ecuador
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=586383" align="left" alt="photo" title="Vicente Adalberto Sisa Naranjo" border="1"/>   </a><b>$850 of $1,000 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Vicente Adalberto Sisa Naranjo is 22 years old. He is single and lives in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador. Vicente is a member of the rural loan group called San Jacinto. The group consists of fifteen members, the majority of whom work in the agricultural sector. Vicente also works in the agriculture sector, earning on average $150 per month. He does the buying and selling of his products in the nearby town of Matilde. Vicente plans to use the loan to grow cacao (used to make chocolate). This year, pests have destroyed much of his cacao crops. Vicente’s dream is to have his own house and a car. In his free time he likes to watch television and play sports. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Mrs. Chann Yoem Village Bank Group : Cambodia
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=586696" align="left" alt="photo" title="Mrs. Chann Yoem Village Bank Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$2,075 of $2,125 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Sixteen people, who live in Damnak village in Takeo province, make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Chann Yoem, who was born in 1960, is the village bank president, having been selected by the other members. Each member will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Chann Yoem is a vegetable and pork seller in her local village where she is able to earn a large profit to support her family. She is also a pig breeder while her husband, Mr. Ly Meun, is a farmer who owns a one-hectare (2.5-acre) plot of land that he uses to cultivate rice to sell to support the family. Since her current business is going sell, Mrs. Chann Yoem wants to expand it. So, to achieve this purpose, she is applying for a loan to buy more pork and vegetables to sell. With the rest of the loan she will buy pig feed. Mrs. Chann Yoem is the mother of three children who are attending school and also helping with their parents’ businesses. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Eliseo Ramon Palacios : Nicaragua
properties.description:
<p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=586984" align="left" alt="photo" title="Eliseo Ramon Palacios" border="1"/>   </a><b>$600 of $700 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Don Eliseo is 42 years old. He has his own business selling scrap. He has been investing in this business for five years and works with two of his children. The problem is that he does not always have much capital when a good amount of scrap becomes available. He wants to start building a small wall because a current runs by his home, and he wants to alter its course by building walls. Things have become very uncomfortable because of the water and because it creates a lot of mud, which produces mosquitoes and unsanitary conditions. He will buy: blocks, iron, cement, supports, sand, piedrin [a type of building stone] and zinc sheets. These loans have been a great opportunity for him, allowing him to make his improvements.
<br /><p><strong>Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer</strong></p>  <br clear="all">

properties.title: Marvin Jose Sandoval : Nicaragua
properties.description:
<p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=586987" align="left" alt="photo" title="Marvin Jose Sandoval" border="1"/>   </a><b>$575 of $700 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Marvin, 45, is a hardworking man who has been a merchant for a number of years. He has a grocery store where he sells a variety of products. Starting out with little, he has managed to grow thanks to his efforts and the support of AFODENIC. He has participated in 11 loan cycles where he has managed to keep his business going and make improvements to his house. What he wants to do is add a room, since he has 3 children, and the room that they have is very uncomfortable. The solution is to build another at the back of the lot. He will buy construction materials such as: stone, sand, iron, cement, and corrugated metal roofing sheets to use in the construction project.
<br /><p><strong>Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer</strong></p>  <br clear="all">

properties.title: Salomon Morales Lizano : Nicaragua
properties.description:
<p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=586991" align="left" alt="photo" title="Salomon Morales Lizano" border="1"/>   </a><b>$450 of $1,025 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Don Salomón is a small businessman who opened his store eleven years ago using his own money. He started with very little, but he has been able to increase his capital with the help of credit opportunities with AFODENIC in which he was able to secure loans. Salomón has invested in office supplies since these products are widely used and always in demand, especially during the school year. <p>
With this loan, he hopes to build an extension to his home that will improve his personal living conditions. He plans to buy construction materials such as stone, sand, cement, iron, zinc, crossbeams, and other items needed to perform the work. <br /><p><strong>Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer</strong></p>  <br clear="all">

properties.title: Mrs. Sivorn Yong Village Bank Group : Cambodia
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=587245" align="left" alt="photo" title="Mrs. Sivorn Yong Village Bank Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$1,825 of $1,975 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> This village bank loan includes 15 people who live in Prey Mul village, Takeo province. Mrs. Sivorn Yong is the village bank president. She was born in 1980 and selected by the other members who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their businesses in this current year. She and her husband, Mr. Chhieng Lorn Hout, are farmers who own a two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. They also grow mushrooms and her husband is also a fisherman. Her problem is that her field has infertile soil and it is time to plow. So to improve rice production, Mrs. Sivorn Yong is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and hire a plow machine to plow her field. She is a mother of four children. One of the children is enrolled in the local school and the others are too small to work or study. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Maricel Elle Group : Philippines
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=583881" align="left" alt="photo" title="Maricel Elle Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$525 of $675 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Maricel Elle is from the village of Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occdiental. She is 41 years old. Maricel is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are each responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Maricel Elle Group'. Maricel is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Maricel owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Maricel has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1200 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Maricel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Maricel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Luzma Capundag's Group : Philippines
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=585886" align="left" alt="photo" title="Luzma Capundag's Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$275 of $1,250 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Luzma Capundag, 43 years old, is from the village of Sinacaban in the province of Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Luzma is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Luzma Capundag's Group. Luzma is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Luzma owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products to the local community. Luzma has run her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 1300 PHP a month. In 2006, Luzma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help develop her business and improve her living situation. Luzma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase inventory & working capital. Luzma is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Luzma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) reaches out to the rural poor in the northwestern Mindanao using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Mrs. Koem Heng Ly Village Bank Group : Cambodia
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=587329" align="left" alt="photo" title="Mrs. Koem Heng Ly Village Bank Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$1,750 of $1,775 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Twelve people who live in Damnak village in Takeo province make up this village bank loan. All the members have selected Mrs. Koem Heng Ly, born in 1961, as village bank president. They will all use their portion of their loan in varied ways to support their families. Mrs. Koem Heng Ly and her husband, Mr. Saroeun Nuon, are farmers who own one-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support their family. Moreover Mrs. Koem Heng Ly is also a pig breeder. Since her pig breeding is going well, she wants to expand. So Mrs. Koem Heng Ly is applying for a loan to buy more piglets and pig feed. She is the mother of four children, one of whom is a translator, while another one is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the others are studying at school. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Mr. Bol Va Village Bank Group : Cambodia
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=587362" align="left" alt="photo" title="Mr. Bol Va Village Bank Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$1,725 of $1,925 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Mr. Bol Va, village bank president, born in 1980, comes from Thum village, Takeo province. The fifteen members of the village bank who elected him will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their current businesses. Mr. Bol Va is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where he can grow rice to sell to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Phearum Prak, is a salesperson at the local market where she can earn a large profit to support her family. Mr. Bol Va's problem is that his wife does not have a motorcycle to transport items for her business. So to improve this business, Mr. Bol Va is asking for a loan to buy a new motorcycle. He is the father of two children both of whom are too young to work or study. On the day of the loan disbursement, Mr. Bol Va was busy working in the field. Instead, his wife, Mrs. Phearum Prak, received the loan for him. Mr. Bol Va's wife is in the photo above. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Esperanza Divina 3 & 4 Group : Dominican Republic
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=587487" align="left" alt="photo" title="Esperanza Divina 3 & 4 Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$3,875 of $3,900 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Dorka is the coordinator of her group, Esperanza Divina 3 & 4 (Divine Hope). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her young child. She says that her most difficult challenge is to build her house. In the meantime, she enjoys being with her child at home. Dorka is excited to be taking her eighth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She has had her business for over 5 years, starting with some savings she had and making the plan to start a business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying underwear, pants and accessories. She will use the profits to invest in her business and to save to start building her house in the near future. This Esperanza associate began with us because she like how the loans work, the group, the community and the opportunities. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Geranios 1 & 2 Group : Dominican Republic
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=587584" align="left" alt="photo" title="Geranios 1 & 2 Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$2,675 of $2,700 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Maria is the coordinator of her group Geranios 1 & 2 (Geraniums). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and 2 children. She says that her most difficult challenge is having a clothing store. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying to share with her family at her home. Maria is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for two years; she started it with some savings and improved it after being invited to a group in her community by a friend. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothing and shoes. She will use the profits to get electrical service and to improve her business. She wants in the near future to have a clothing store. This Esperanza associate began with us because "I like the payments plan and interest, also i'm learning how to do business". Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally, her group is located in Los Arcarrizos, a dusty industrial area north of the capital where free trade zones are common. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Randy Maquiling : Philippines
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=585885" align="left" alt="photo" title="Randy Maquiling" border="1"/>   </a><b>$150 of $450 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Randy Maquiling is from the village of Agunod Plaridel Misamis Occidental. He is 38 years old. Randy is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Randy owns a specialized retail store which sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, and bread in the local community. Randy has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Randy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Randy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Randy is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Mrs. Phorn Nget Village Bank Group : Cambodia
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=588420" align="left" alt="photo" title="Mrs. Phorn Nget Village Bank Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$1,925 of $1,975 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> This village bank loan is made up of 16 people who live in Tuol Pongro village in Takeo province. Mrs. Phorn Nget has been selected as the village bank president by other members. Each group member will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose. Phorn Nget, born in 1972, owns a general store in the local village and is also a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. On Sam, is a farmer who owns one-and-half hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to support his family. Her piglets are too small to sell, and she does not have enough money to support them. So to improve the breeding of pigs, Mrs. Phorn Nget is seeking a loan to buy pig food and use the rest of the loan to buy pesticides. She has two children who are attending school. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Mr. Mus Nhoem Village Bank Group : Cambodia
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=588438" align="left" alt="photo" title="Mr. Mus Nhoem Village Bank Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$1,950 of $2,075 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> This village bank loan is made up of 14 members who live in Tuol Pongro village in Takeo province. The members have selected Mr. Mus Nhoem as their village bank president. Each member will use their portion of the loan to support their individual businesses. Mr. Mus Nhoem, 47, and his wife, Mrs. Khon Khem, are farmers who own a one-point-four hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to support their family. Mus also works as a rock breaker to support his family. His field has infertile soil and is infected with insects. To improve the production of rice, Mr. Mus Nhoem is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and use the rest of the loan to hire a plow machine to plow his field. He is a father of four children, all of whom are studying in school and are helping their parents’ businesses. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Narman Aliyev : Azerbaijan
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=588562" align="left" alt="photo" title="Narman Aliyev" border="1"/>   </a><b>$975 of $1,125 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Narman Aliyev is a 40-year-old trader who has sold products for the home and electrical goods for the last three years. He is married and has two children. He started his business with some savings and a year ago, he was able to build his own shop. His monthly income is about 250-350 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN) and he is going to increase it to 500-600 AZN. Narman applied for a 900 AZN loan to increase the number of items he sells. He believes this loan will help him to improve the living conditions of his family. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Agagul Abbasov : Azerbaijan
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=588599" align="left" alt="photo" title="Agagul Abbasov" border="1"/>   </a><b>$925 of $1,250 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Agagul Abbasov is 40 years old. Ten years ago, he started a business selling cell phones and phone accessorizes. Agagul believes that this business is profitable and the income he generates allows him to support his family. His monthly income is about 300-400 AZN. The product he sells is in very high demand among local people and Agagul is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN to purchase more phones and accessorize to increase his profit. This is his second loan and he promise to repay it in a timely manner like the first one, which he successfully completed. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Tayyar Quliyev : Azerbaijan
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=588613" align="left" alt="photo" title="Tayyar Quliyev" border="1"/>   </a><b>$825 of $1,000 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Tayyar Quliyev, 54, is married and has four children. He lives in Imishli city and works with his family in the agricultural industry and at his petrol station business. Many years ago he decided to cultivate his land to generate more income to support his family. Now he applied for a 800 AZN loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and one calf. Tayyar enjoys doing this job and his monthly income is about 300-500 AZN, With his last loan, Tayyar improved his petrol station, which he already successfully repaid. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Juan Carlos Castellon : Nicaragua
Las Vegas Group : Peru
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=588665" align="left" alt="photo" title="Las Vegas Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$2,800 of $2,975 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> The Las Vegas village bank is currently in its sixth loan cycle. Its hardworking, enterprising members are always looking for opportunities to improve their lives and work daily to provide a better future for their children. The group meets every thirty days in the main office of the Institución de Microfinanzas Arariwa, located in the Wanchaq district of Cusco province. Most of the members sell products for a living. Kathia is 36 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, where she was born, with her partner and their three children. Kathia sells clothing, perfumes, and jewelry to friends, neighbors, and workers in public and private institutions. She travels to the cities of Lima and Tacna twice in order to purchase more merchandise. She sells from home seven days a week, from 9 in the morning until 1 in the afternoon. For her next loan, Kathia hopes to receive 1000 soles. At the moment her store is modestly stocked with the basic necessities. She'd like to use the loan to buy jewelry, clothing, and much more. Kathia is one of the founding members of the village bank and is punctual and responsible with her payments.<br /><p><strong>Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer</strong></p>  <br clear="all">

properties.title: Union Por El Progreso 2 & 3 Group : Dominican Republic
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=589747" align="left" alt="photo" title="Union Por El Progreso 2 & 3 Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$2,375 of $3,250 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Pilar is the coordinator of her group, Unidos por el progreso 2 & 3 (unite to progress). She makes her home here in a simple structure with 3 children and her long term partner. She says that her most difficult challenge is to have a successful business. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying to cook an go to the church. Pilar is excited to be taking her 8th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for more than 5 years, starting with a small amount of money that she saved to start a business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying charcoal, baked foods and candies. She will use the profits to help her children, to save and finish building her house and she is planing to finish her high school studies. This Esperanza associate began with us because, she says "I really like what Esperanza offers". Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients in general. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Siempre Adelante Group : Peru
properties.description:
<p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=589764" align="left" alt="photo" title="Siempre Adelante Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$2,650 of $2,700 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Deyby Chavesta Custodio is 54 years old (wearing red pants and a cherry colored sweater in the photograph) is the president of the “Siempre Adelante” (Always Ahead) communal bank. She is a very entrepreneurial mother of two children. She struggles daily to move them ahead, give them a better quality of life, and provide them with a basic education in values and principles. The communal bank is made up of nine enthusiastic and committed women and one gentleman. They have been working with EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD for the past 18 months. Deyby currently has two businesses, one is a call center called “Divino Niño Jesús,” which she has had for one year; she also sells prepared food out of her parent’s home (where she lives). From there she distributes lunches to her steady customers in factories and to people who want to experience the flavor in the home where she prepares them. Deyby dreams of having her own home and is very optimistic that she will be able to buy a piece of land soon, thanks to her savings and the income that she has gotten from her two businesses. She wants to run both businesses out of her own home. She will use the money from this loan as working capital to buy three more call booths, because of high customer demand.
<br /><p><strong>Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer</strong></p>  <br clear="all">

properties.title: Victoria : Peru
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=590347" align="left" alt="photo" title="Victoria" border="1"/>   </a><b>$700 of $725 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Victoria, age 59, is a very hard-working mother. She lives at home with her daughter and her two grandchildren. In light of the fact that her daughter sells cosmetics, she decided to help her. At the end of a year she had her own orders for these beauty products. From then on, after taking care of her grandchildren, she sells her merchandise to her family and friends. That is how she works. She likes the business that she has a lot. It makes her independent, and she generates her own income. Also, she really likes the company of her friends and the people she talks with in order to offer the product that she sells. In the future she would like to expand her business. She would also like to grow potato crops in her village again. That way of life was very nice. This is her tenth loan with MFP, and she knows that it is very useful to her. She promises to make her payments on time. She will use the requested loan to buy diverse beauty products. That way she plans to fill the pending orders that she has. <br /><p><strong>Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer</strong></p>  <br clear="all">

properties.title: Guloglan Hasanov : Azerbaijan
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=590426" align="left" alt="photo" title="Guloglan Hasanov" border="1"/>   </a><b>$900 of $1,250 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 2, 2010 <br/> <br/> Guloglan Hasanov is a hardworking man who works in the cattle raising business. He has six children. He works hard to provide everything his family needs. Presently, Guloglan is sacrificing and working hard to grow his business. He is a widower and runs his business alone. His monthly income is about 250-300 AZN from selling cattle and dairy products to local farmers. He is requesting a loan to purchase more cattle. He plans to feed and raise the cows and maximize his investment by selling milk products and meat. This will be his first loan with AqroInvest and Kiva. His 20 years of experience and deep knowledge in this field makes him qualified to receive the loan. </p> <br clear="all">

properties.title: Ferdinand Icyobanziriye : Rwanda
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=591045" align="left" alt="photo" title="Ferdinand Icyobanziriye" border="1"/>   </a><b>$525 of $550 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 17, 2010 <br/> <br/> Ferdinand Icyobanziriye is a 26 year old man who was born in the Gahanga district of Kicukiro province, city of Kigali. He has completed elementary school. He has three children, the oldest is 6 years old and the second is 3 years old. The children do not go to school yet. Mr. Icyobanziriye works as a mason's aide in a roadway construction company. He has had a savings account with Amasezerano Community Banking since April 2007. He is seeking a loan, partly to finish the house and partly to pay tuition fees for his younger brother. Mr. Icyobanziriye's wish and ambition is to have a rental house that will be the inheritance for his eldest son. The house's rent would generate income for the education of his children. He hopes to also improve living conditions for his family. <br /><p><strong>Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer</strong></p>  <br clear="all">

properties.title: Wiliam Fernando Martinez Cortez : Nicaragua
Janechit Rosell's Group : Philippines
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.kiva.org/image.php?type=thumbnail&id=585406" align="left" alt="photo" title="Janechit Rosell's Group" border="1"/>   </a><b>$625 of $725 raised.<br/><br/></b> Started raising funds on Sep 1, 2010 <br/> <br/> Mrs. Janechit Rosell, 33 years old and married, is a resident of Catadman, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. Janechit is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Janechit Rosell’s Group. <p>Janechit is blessed with 2 school-aged children. She is involved in operating a sari-sari (variety) store and selling longganisa (sausages). Janechit receives support from her husband, Marcelino, who is an automotive painter. After 3 years of operating the store and selling longganisa, Janechit is able to maintain the business and the couple now earns an average monthly net income of at least PHP 6,000, which is very helpful to their family income. <p>Janechit joined the cooperative in 2009 upon hearing the good news of PAGLAUM MPC being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao.
