Her husband left her when the baby was very young and she decided to take on work which could help her with expenses. What she wants is for this business to progress, and that with the blessing of God she can in time enlarge her business to support her daughter, so she can get a profession.

properties.title: Anonymous : Sierra Leone
properties.description: $400 of $700 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 28, 2011 This is a 35-year-old businesswoman. She is married, and has 4 children aged 16, 13, 10 and 7 years. In 2006, she established her plastic slippers business. She began her business because she wants to be independent and be able to provide a livelihood for her family. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 700,000 SLL (~$163) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. She requires this loan in order to buy more assorted plastic slippers for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL (~$47). In the future, she plans to own a bigger shop, build a house and educate her children. The persistent increase in the prices of goods is her major business challenge. She thanks you for your support.

properties.title: Najma's Group : Pakistan
properties.description: $175 of $425 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 28, 2011 Najma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy plastic bottles in bulk quantity to be able to provide to different medical clinics and medicine sellers. He has been operating this business for many years. His buyers use the plastic bottles for filling with medicines like syrups etc. Najma herself is a housewife and manages her household work by staying at home. She gets up early in the morning, cleans the whole house and cooks food for her family. She enjoys doing household work and feels healthy by taking care of her family and fulfilling their needs. She hopes that the loan investment will bring her husband’s business to a more profitable position and increase his clientele base. Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Najma.

properties.title: Echangeur Plus Group : The Democratic Republic of the Congo
properties.description: $2,500 of $4,000 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 4, 2011 Mbula is the president of the Community Bank named “Echangeur Plus”, which is composed of 10 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. Mbula’s main business is selling appliances in the eastern area of the city of Kinshasa. He has been in the micro enterprise world for years and has acquired solid experience in this area. With hard work and determination, his business has prospered. Mbula is now well-known and liked in this area. He has already received MFI HOPE DRC loans ten times and fully repaid them. He makes $80 profit each week. He intends with the next loan to increase the stock of his goods to meet customer demand and generate additional profits. His ambition is to become an appliance provider in his area. He is 38 years old and married without children. He takes care of a nephew and a niece.

properties.title: Miryam Rangel Suarez : Colombia
properties.description: $25 of $575 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 7, 2011 Miryam lives in the town of Soledad with her husband and four children whose ages range from 11 to 21. She makes and sells “picadas” (combination plates containing various fried meats, sausages, offal, manioc and potatoes), a business that arose from the need to generate income and that started as a sale of fried fast food when her husband became unemployed. As the business started to take shape she started adding other items derived from wheat flour. Although she had very little working capital to cover her initial demand, she still stove to accomplish it. Her husband has always been by her side and when Miryam became ill he took over the entire operation and still continues to help her out. Her Kiva loan is the first financing she’s gotten from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy raw materials and ingredients like corn, sugar, manioc, wheat flour and milk. Her dream is to position it and she’s starting to do so. With help from the Fundación she’s managed to increase her working capital, diversify her offer and concentrate on new markets like sites that are used for special events and family parties which are her most valued customers. She is currently hoping to get a housing subsidy for Villas de San Pedro where the Fundación is developing its mission statement‘s focus on building sustainable communities.

properties.title: Donis Luis : Nicaragua
properties.description: $175 of $450 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 14, 2011 Donis is 30 years old and originally from Quezalguaque - a village in León. He has two children and is a salesman. Donis sells CDs and DVDs. He used to work in on the land, then he worked in construction. Two years ago he started working in sales, selling CDs and DVDs. His wife helps him in the business. They make their sales in the bus station market. Donis requested this loan to buy CDs, Play Station 2 games and cell phones to sell in his premises. With this investment, he hopes to attract more customers and improve his sales and income. In the future, he would like to own a video game store and sell cell phones wholesale. His next goal is to set up premises where he will sell chicken.

properties.title: Roza Poghosyan : Armenia
properties.description: $2,650 of $3,000 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 1, 2011 Roza works at her city’s local TV station and lives with her parents, who are pensioners, and a brother who is unemployed. She supplements her income by selling milk from a cow she owns and by running her own fruit orchard. She and her family use this income to buy food, but it is not enough for provide them with a reasonable life. That is why Roza is applying for a loan to buy three new cows. This will help her and her family earn additional income and live a better life.

properties.title: Buyan-Nemekh Dorj : Mongolia
properties.description: $1,000 of $1,200 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 28, 2011 Buyan-Nemekh is 41 years old and lives with her family in a small house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She works as a cleaner at two companies, while her husband runs a taxi business. In addition, her 17-year-old daughter attends public high school and her son currently has not yet found a job. Buyan-Nemekh’s small house needs some work to be done on the outside and inside as well. She is requesting a 1,500,000 loan to buy materials such as, cement, bricks, wallpaper, wallpaper paste, vacuum-insulated window and other necessary materials to finish her homebuilding and renovating work. Recently, their family bought a 32 Inch LCD television and replaced their car with a better one, with the profits that Buyan-Nemekh’s husband made. Buyan-Nemekh and her husband want to improve their living standards so that their family can enjoy safe and comfortable living conditions.

properties.title: Santos Joel Llontop Ramirez : Peru
properties.description: $325 of $750 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 1, 2011 Santos is 28 years old. He is married and has 2 minor children. He has his own house which is located in the settlement of Valle Nuevo in the Mochumi district, 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Santos earns a living through the sale of a variety of small animals like hens, turkeys and ducks. He breeds them in pens situated in the back of his home. He is building up this business in the central market or in the various settlements near Mochumi. He has been engaged in this activity for six years during which time he has acquired experience in the area and loyal customers for his business. Santos is requesting a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the fattening of his fowl. With this loan he will buy feed for said animals as well as be able to improve pens to that end. Santos is an enterprising and responsible person. He wants to be able to grow as an entrepreneur and be able to provide his family with a better quality of life.

properties.title: Jiguiseme 3 Group : Mali
properties.description: $2,350 of $2,875 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 1, 2011 The 10 members of the Jiguiseme 3 group are married men averaging 41 years of age, with five children, and living with their wives and children in Foh, a village about 35 km from the city of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali). These farmers are on their 10th loan cycle with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the goal of meeting customer demand. All prior loans have been repaid satisfactorily. This farmers’ group has been cultivating and selling corn for years. This is a profitable activity in the region. Klezanza, standing in the middle in the photo is the group’s leader. He plans to use his loan in the following way: to buy six bags of urea, four bags of complex fertilizer, five liters of herbicides and to use the rest to pay manual labor. He plans to achieve an average monthly income of 90,000, which will be used for everyday family expenses.

properties.title: Alice : Rwanda
properties.description: $1,000 of $1,150 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 1, 2011 Alice is 34 years old and married with two children who are 3 and 7 years old. She earns a living by selling cosmetics. This is her fifth successful year in business. Her business is well-organized. She operates her business from 8 a.m until 6 p.m every day except on Saturday. She employs one person to help her. Alice has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more cosmetics to sell. By adding more products and workers, she hopes to earn more profit. With the profit, she will save for her family and reinvest in her business.

properties.title: Mary Melesi : South Sudan
properties.description: $100 of $375 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 7, 2011 Mary has a small food stall. After receiving this money, she will expand her business so that she can send her children to school.

properties.title: Lucia : Philippines
properties.description: $150 of $250 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 27, 2011 Lucia is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. Lucia has a shop that sells snacks, breads & biscuits. She has had this business for 20 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & breads to resell. Lucia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Lucia hopes to improve her business.

properties.title: Moreen Khakasa : Kenya
properties.description: $150 of $225 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 29, 2011 Moreen, a married mother of three boys and one girl, owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. For the past three years, Moreen has operated a beauty salon and a cyber café. She also owns real estate which is her other source of income. Her customers are neighbours and passersby. Seasonality is a major challenge she faces in her business. Having decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business, she is requesting a loan of Kshs 20,000 to purchase cosmetics for her beauty salon. Moreen's dream is to expand her business in the future.

properties.title: Las Fresitas De Dolores Group : Mexico
properties.description: $2,125 of $2,375 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 5, 2011 This group is called "Las Fresitas de Dolores". Eulalia is the group's president. Her group has eight members who are all very committed to their work. The group is located in Hidalgo, Mexico. One of the most important attractions of their community is the big fiesta which is held on the 2nd of February, when they celebrate the Virgin of Candelaria. Eulalia is 42 years old. She completed elementary school, is married, and has three children (two sons and one daughter). Her business is selling ladies' underwear. She is requesting this loan to invest in buying underwear wholesale since it is cheaper. Her customers are loyal to her business because she offers all sizes, styles and colors and her payments are very affordable. She would like to save the profits that she makes so that she can continue investing in her business and support her husband in covering their family expenses and paying for their children's education.

properties.title: Simon : Bolivia
properties.description: $500 of $700 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 12, 2011 Simón is an office worker; he and his wife work for the same company. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a car, which will help them easily reach his place of work as they live quite far away from it. He lives in his parents’ house in Achachicala, a neighborhood of the capital La Paz. Simón is married and has two children. This borrower is very satisfied with the loan he has previously been granted, and his repayment history is excellent.

properties.title: Pedro Francisco Medina : Nicaragua
properties.description: $425 of $825 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 12, 2011 Pedro Francisco has two adult children. His economic activity is being a basic grains vendor. He goes out to different places to sell his products and this is how he managed to acquire many customers. Now, he’s asking for a loan that he’ll use as working capital to buy rice, beans, oil, corn and concentrate, among others. Pedro’s dream is to increase his business so that he can assure his family’s future.

properties.title: Maha Nemran : Jordan
properties.description: $400 of $1,275 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 21, 2011 Maha is a 40-year-old woman who is married to Abd Aljaleel. They have five children. Maha wanted to support her husband and her family, but at the same time wanted to dedicate herself to her children, so she opened a small food store in their neighborhood for her husband two years ago, and it has been running very successfully. Now Maha has applied for a loan to buy products for the store that their customers are asking for but that they do not presently stock. Since Maha is a conservative person, her husband Abd Aljaleel appears in the photo instead.

properties.title: Ayidote Guindehoug Group : Benin
properties.description: $325 of $475 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 1, 2011 The Ayidote Guindehoug group is made up of three people, all living in the same geographic region in Benin. The group’s representative, Assiba Josephine, is the one raising her hand in the photo. She was born in 1950 in a city in Benin. She is a widow and a mother of three; all children attend school, and two are still in her care. Assiba Josephine is able to provide for her family’s expenses alone, thanks to her income from her business. She never attended school. For about seven years, she has been selling “akassa” (a local food made from corn starch) and fried fish in her neighborhood. On the side, she also sells firewood. She buys her supplies in a city in Benin. This is the first time that Assiba Josephine and the other members of the Ayidote Guindehoug group are asking for a loan from Alidé. This loan will help grow their business in order to better meet their customers’ demand.

properties.title: Paola Maria Otero Donoso : Ecuador
properties.description: $925 of $1,000 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 27, 2011 Paola is 30 years old, lives in Duran Spring (the city boundary was originally irregular with various hills, streams, and lagoons which are remains of a deteriorating ecosystem). She is separated and has three children who attend public school. She sells food for her business. After her separation she decided to start selling food to pay for house payments. She begins working on her own at 6 am to make meals and by midday begins selling them. She plans on using the loan to buy utensils for her business such as dishes, cups, and other supplies. In the future she would like to expand her business to other provinces.

properties.title: Raeesa's Group : Pakistan
properties.description: $850 of $1,875 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 24, 2011 Raeesa is 26 years old, married with three children. Two of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Her husband deals with construction supplies. He provides construction supplies such as cement, bricks and sands to his customers at reasonable rates and generates income for the family. Raeesa herself is a beautician as well as running a boutique business. She provides her services to her female clients. She operates her businesses from her home and is known as an expert in her fields. Her clientele base is her community women. They prefer to approach her to buy dresses and for getting beauty services. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of both her businesses. With the loan, she will buy beauty products (creams, masks) and makeup items (lipsticks, mascara, eye shadow) etc. and clothes and thread to be able to provide better services to her clients and increase her profit. She is confident that her businesses will grow further after the loan investment.

properties.title: Soklis Chin : Cambodia
properties.description: $775 of $1,000 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 7, 2011 Soklis, 31 years old, is a grocery seller. Her husband is a worker making hand grinding products. Their income is $9 per day. They have 4 children, 2 are studying and the other two are staying with their aunt in Phnom Penh. Each month, Soklis spends $40 on food, $10 on school fees and $8 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy grocery items and pigs to feed. Her family is depending on her income the most. She needs to make more income to support the children, who are studying.

properties.title: Nazareth Del Socorro Castaño Rodriguez : Colombia
properties.description: $375 of $1,125 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 3, 2011 Nazareth is an indefatigable fighter, since from a very early age she has looked for a way to get ahead via different lines of work, among them, as an assistant in a hair salon. There she learned everything having to do with this type of work until, some time ago, she decided to fly solo and create her own business, Style and Beauty. Although this entrepreneur works over 11 hours a day, seven days a week, she is aware that this is the way to get ahead and improve the quality of life for her and her family. At 45 years of age, Nazareth is the mother of five children. She dreams of expanding her business and making it a hair salon that is known not only in Puerto Berrío Antioquia but also in the surrounding municipalities. Currently she needs a loan to purchase beauty items that she may sell in her hair salon and thus increase her earnings.

properties.title: Ekua Akyimiba : Ghana
properties.description: $175 of $275 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 3, 2011 Ekua sells gari, kenkey and fish at Elmina. In the picture, her right hand is in the corn dough she would be using for the kenkey. She is married and blessed with four wonderful children. Her husband is into fitting. This business has been in existence for 4 years. As part of her responsibilities she supports her husband by providing the basic needs of her family. Her loan will be used to buy additional bags of maize and fresh fish to fry for sale. She wishes to use the new profits from her business to acquire a shop.

properties.title: Ana Jensy Barquero Gamboa : Costa Rica
properties.description: $575 of $1,000 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 4, 2011 Ana Jensy is 25 years old, single, and currently lives alone. She plans to use the loan money to purchase merchandise for her pulpería [small grocery store] and to have a greater variety of products. She has the space at her disposal and would like to offer her customers a greater selection of products in order to increase her clientele and create income for her future. Ana would like to generate income now, when she does not have any responsibilities, so that she can save her earnings to have more economic stability and well-being for her family in the future. This is the first loan she has received through FUDECOSUR. She has not had previous loans through state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

properties.title: Anonymous : Lebanon
properties.description: $975 of $1,000 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 10, 2011 This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living on his own. In 2007, this man decided to start his own business selling coffee using a special carrier. He travels across different areas and villages to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional products needed. He’s planning to expand his business in order to earn a greater income. In the future, he is hoping to open his own coffee shop.

properties.title: Clarisa Casiano : Philippines
properties.description: $150 of $700 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 4, 2011 Clarisa is married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Clarisa is 35 years old and has three children who are in school. Clarisa has a livestock raising business in the Philippines. Clarisa requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy "carabao" (water buffalo) to raise. Clarisa has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Clarisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and improve her family's livelihood.

properties.title: Artur Galstyan : Armenia
properties.description: $100 of $3,000 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 1, 2011 Artur is engaged in an agricultural business. He keeps livestock and has agro machinery. Agriculture is the family’s main source of income, but it is not enough to cover their daily costs. Artur would like to increase his number of livestock and develop his business further. Artur dreams of improving his household conditions and provide necessary education for his growing children. Artur lives with his wife and two little children.

properties.title: Henry : Bolivia
properties.description: $50 of $500 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 18, 2011 Henry is employed by a crane and lift company. On the week-ends he helps his mother sell CDs at different fairs in the city of El Alto. He will use the loan to cover the fees to get his driver’s license. He lives in his own house in the Villa Esperanza zone in the city of El Alto. He is married, but he does not have children.

properties.title: Rwenkuba Bakyara Tukole Group, Rukungiri : Uganda
properties.description: $2,350 of $3,175 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 21, 2011 Ireen leads the Rwenkuba Bakyara Tukole group, Rukungiri. She is 56 years old, married and has four children, one of whom is still in school. For the last seven years, she has made a living by running a retail shop in the Katerera Trading Centre where she sells basic items such as sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil. Most of her customers live nearby. In a typical month, Ireen makes 200,000 UGX, which she has used to pay off a previous loan and expand her shop. She also runs a business on the side raising pigs and owns several rental properties, and all her work has allowed her to dramatically improve her life and her family's. She is determined to educate her children and increase her sales. She is applying for this loan to pay her child's school fees and restock her shop with goods.

properties.title: Edgar Armando Cun Nech : Guatemala
properties.description: $350 of $1,175 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 3, 2011 Edgar, 31, is married and has four children; the two oldest attend the local secondary school. His business is selling home appliances. He started it five years ago. He is asking for this loan to buy more merchandise because his customers place large orders and he needs capital to meet customer demand. His dream is to enlarge the business more and provide a better future for his children.

properties.title: Raeda Hijazi : Palestine
properties.description: $450 of $2,500 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 24, 2011 Raeda is a young woman from Jabalia Refugee Camp in Gaza Strip. Raeda has two daughters and two sons. She took out a loan from FATEN to purchase furniture for her daughters. The four children used to share the same room but, now that they are growing up, the children need their own rooms. Raeda's husband is an employee and can't furnish the room from his salary, though he can pay FATEN back on a monthly basis. Raeda's husband is photographed instead of her as she is a conservative woman (as are most of Gaza Strip inhabitants).

properties.title: Dembereldavaa Tsoodol : Mongolia
properties.description: $75 of $650 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 7, 2011 Dembereldavaa is 22 years old who lives with his mother and older sister in a house in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His mother is retired while her older sister manages a clothing trading business. He manages a taxi service business in his town. He started his business in 2010. He is a safe and reliable driver who provides comfortable service for his customers. He is planning to have repair done for his car in order to provide safe drive for his customers. He is a hardworking young man who says, "I am planning to continue business in the future." He is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase new parts for his car.

properties.title: Nephat Ngigi : Kenya
properties.description: $350 of $900 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 27, 2011 Nephat has been extracting stones from quarries in Naivasha town for the last nine years. He is 39 years old, married to Lydia and they have six school going children. He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of 40,000 KES well and in good time. He used the previous loan amount to buy another quarry. He plans to use the loan amount to buy another quarry site and employ casual workers so that he may increase his production. In future, Nephat hopes to grow and own many quarries.

properties.title: Kokui : Togo
properties.description: $375 of $1,100 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 24, 2011 Selling staple goods (rice, sugar, vegetable oil) since 2000, Kokui is the mother of two children. She is 34 and her husband is a taxi driver. She usually buys her supplies at the Grand Market in Lomé and sells them in her little store in DJIDJOLE. This third loan will serve to buy merchandise, in view of the fact that she is running low on goods to sell to her clientele.

properties.title: Jean Pierre : Rwanda
properties.description: $425 of $850 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 4, 2011 Jean Pierre is 31 years old and married. He has owned a motorcycle transport business for the past 11 years. His business is well organized and open daily from 7 a.m. until 7 p.m. Jean Pierre has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy essential materials like tires and engine for his motorcycle. With his profits, he plans to reinvest in his business and to save for his future.

properties.title: Asuncion Lizana Cruz : Peru
properties.description: $375 of $725 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 2, 2011 Asunción is a 30-year-old father living with his wife and son in a house belonging to relatives that only has electricity located in the rural part of José Leonardo Ortíz District belonging to Chiclayo Province. Residents of the district are retail and wholesale merchants of products and are farmers. For a few years now Asunción has been a mototaxi driver (mode of transportation used to go short distances with a maximum of three passengers) in his own district taking people to various destinations. He has a few regular customers despite existing competition. He tries his best to transport the largest number of passengers and uses income generated by this activity to try to cover family obligations. The loan he’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for is for 2000 new soles and it will be used to service the mototaxi in order to continue to offer good service but he’ll also use it to cover some personal expenses. Asunción is a much respected, well known man in his local area for being hard working, responsible and a good father whose only aim is that his family have everything they need.

properties.title: Betty Sadia : South Sudan
properties.description: $75 of $200 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 8, 2011 She is 28 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are now in school. If she can open a beauty salon, she can send another child to school.

properties.title: Nicolas : Bolivia
properties.description: $1,100 of $1,200 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 27, 2011 Nicolas is a milk producer and also, works as a brick mason. He lives in his own house, located in Achacachi, in the department of La Paz. He is married and has 3 children. The loan he requests is for buying farm land that he needs for sowing forage crops to feed his milk cows.

properties.title: Paz : El Salvador
properties.description: $200 of $600 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 6, 2011 Paz, aged fifty-five, lives with her life partner and children in their own home. She makes bed linens and sells them in different places. She has many customers because her products are of good quality, have different designs, and are cheap. Paz is always ahead of the competition as she seeks to keep things new, and she always meets her goals. She is an enterprising woman who is eager to get ahead, which is why she decided to ask for a loan through INTEGRAL. This will allow her to purchase materials for her products such as fabric, thread, needles, cotton, bags for packaging and other things. In this way Paz can continue with her production and not disappoint her customers. She also hopes that her work may bring economic security to her home and a better quality of life for her family.

properties.title: Reuben Rotich : Kenya
properties.description: $200 of $700 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 27, 2011 Reuben is aged 35 and married with two children. He has a mixed farm in Kitale town, western Kenya, where he produces milk and grows maize and beans. He has been farming for twelve years now and sells his produce locally. He is also a mason. With a loan of 62,400 KES, he intends to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes that he will be able to purchase a quality dairy cow which will produce enough milk for domestic sale and family consumption. He faces the challenge of the fluctuation in market prices for farm produce and the lack of enough animal feed. The extra income from this loan will enable him to afford a better life for his family.

properties.title: María Cristina Torrez : Nicaragua
properties.description: $250 of $450 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 28, 2011 Mrs. Maria Christina is a hardworking and enterprising woman who is 53 years old. She has had a tailor shop for the past 30 years. She began this business with her husband. In the beginning they sold their products in the marketplace. Little by little their business grew because of their hard work and cooperation. Her husband is in charge of sales and Maria Christina manages the workshop, which includes six employees. Maria Christina will invest the loan money in fabric, especially fabric for uniforms for security guard agencies that currently have more than 100 uniforms.

properties.title: Las Tres Estrellas Group : Mexico
properties.description: $125 of $600 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 7, 2011 Señora Irene is married and lives in the area of Ribera la Granadilla, in the Municipality of Coapilla in Chiapas State, Mexico. She works baking bread, which she has been doing for two years and three months. She says it's going well, as with this she is able to support her household by providing income. While she does not have a large family, she wants the best for them. She started in this activity with her own creativity and so supports her husband with household income. Together they are saving for when they have children. She doesn't want them to lack anything important, and just wants them to be able to get ahead in life. Her greatest wish is that she can continue working with this small business and provide the best for her first child who is due in a few months. The people who make up the rest of the group are: Señora Timonea who buys chickens to season and sell, and Señora Trinidad who buys palm fronds to make mats.

properties.title: Simon Aharonyan : Armenia
properties.description: $250 of $3,000 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 1, 2011 Simon is engaged in agriculture. He keeps livestock and an orchard. He lives together with his mother. His father passed a few years ago. The son inherited the farm and the fruit orchard, and thanks to his hard work, managed to increase the business. He wishes to increase the livestock and develop his business further. The increased income will allow Simon to create better living conditions and create his own family in the future.

properties.title: Heng : Cambodia
properties.description: $775 of $800 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 1, 2011 Heng is a 47-year-old man who provides the motor taxi service to people who need to go anywhere in and around Kompong Cham Province. He has over 10 years' experience in this occupation and frequently earns around $1.50 each day to support his family with financial expenses. In order to contribute to their income, Heng’s wife works in a farm field planting a crop twice per year. They have four children who live under the roof with them. One of their children works in a garment factory as a sewing worker. Heng will be using his loan to buy a new motorcycle to replace the old one which often breaks down.

properties.title: Kazem Farhan Olwan : Iraq
properties.description: $600 of $3,000 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 23, 2011 This borrower is from Iraq. He is 52 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom work. Kazem has a wholesale food market since 2007, selling flour and oils. He has a good reputation and he is committed to his work and loyal to his clients. He is requesting a $3000 loan to buy a tricycle (Stota), split air conditioner and to make a sliding door for his market. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

properties.title: Devine Touch Group : Zimbabwe
properties.description: $1,375 of $1,450 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 2, 2011 Hellen (the lady with the black scarf) is 52 years of age and from the city Mutare, the capital of Manicaland province in Zimbabwe. She is married with five children, with one attending school. She also cares for three dependents. Hellen runs a business selling clothes. The business has been in operation for 20 years. She says the main challenge faced is late payments from clients. Hellen has requested a loan of $250 to buy more t-shirts, blouses and warm-type clothing for winter. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the family’s quality of life. In the future, Hellen plans to have a well-established business.

properties.title: Jack Merlin Campos Mendoza : Ecuador
properties.description: $375 of $1,000 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 24, 2011 Jack, 57, lives in an urban zone in El Guasmo, so called because of a species of tree: Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo is a low-income neighborhood which used to be a hacienda in Guayaquil. His wife’s a housewife and he has adult children. His activity is an auto repair shop. He started a few years back and chose the activity of repairing cars because he learned how when he was still a little boy. The shop is open from 8am to 6pm. With help from the loan he wants to buy more spare parts to sell and to use to repair his customers’ cars in order to increase profits. In the future, he’d like to expand his repair shop.

properties.title: Stone Quarry Development Group : Uganda
properties.description: $2,375 of $2,625 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 24, 2011 50 year old Alice, a happily married mother of 3, has been engaged in a stone quarry business for the past 18 years in Mukono. She says she began this business under the auspices of her husband. Stone quarrying is a business which involves a lot of elbow grease. For that reason, Alice employs sturdy and dynamic young men to do most of the work. She lays great store upon hard work and this philosophy has trickled down to her workers. She says this business generates profits totaling up to 180,000 shillings monthly. The purpose of this loan, she says, is to help her purchase more stones for usage at her quarry. Client demand has increased and the purchase of more stones will enable her to meet their demands.

properties.title: Adeth's Group : Pakistan
properties.description: $450 of $1,000 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 7, 2011 Adeth is a widow who has two sons. Both of them are young and do work to survive financially. The eldest one grows different fruits by renting a garden and the youngest one works in a food restaurant. She stays at home to do her household responsibilities. Adeth has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her eldest son who will use the loan to pay rent in advance for his garden so he will be able to grow fruit without any problem and generate the maximum profits. He has been operating this business for the past 10 years and Adeth is hopeful that an investment will put her son’s business in a more profitable position and improve the living standard of her family. Both of her sons are unmarried and she is hopeful that she will be able to save some profits for the marriage of her eldest son in the near future. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit record and never missed any meeting. Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Adeth.

properties.title: Sreymao Chhor : Cambodia
properties.description: $300 of $600 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 7, 2011 Sreymao (pictured here) runs a grocery store at home. Her husband, Chan, is a construction worker. She is applying for a loan of $600 to purchase additional grocery items for her inventory. The couple lives on an island located 15 kilometers Phnom Penh City. They have two sons and three daughters.

properties.title: Lucy Bacsan : Philippines
properties.description: $200 of $475 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 7, 2011 Lucy is 37 years old and lives in Plaridel. She is married with three children. Lucy has a bamboo furniture business and earns approximately 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 20,000 PHP to purchase materials for her bamboo furniture. Lucy has been a member of PMPC for three years.

properties.title: Jeanne D'arc : Rwanda
properties.description: $650 of $1,025 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 7, 2011 Jeanne D'arc is 27 years old. She is married with one child who is 1 year old. Jeanne D'arc owns a small business selling various styles of African clothes for women. This business is well-known and organized. The hours of her business are from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day except on the weekend. She has one year of experience in this business. Jeanne D'arc has requested her first loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to expand her business by purchasing more African clothes for women for sale. Once this expansion is reached, Jeanne D'arc will be able to earn more profit. She wants her business to be wholesale. With any profits, she will build her own house and reinvest in her business.

properties.title: Tashinga B Seke South Group : Zimbabwe
properties.description: $1,950 of $2,000 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 1, 2011 This is 65-year-old Ruth (in the middle) from Chitungwiza, a high-density suburb about 30 km. from Harare. She is married with three children, all attending school. She also cares for four dependents. Ruth runs a clothing business selling ladies clothes. The business has been in operation for 5 years. She says the main challenge faced is the lack of capital to meet her order demands. Ruth has requested a loan of $400 to buy shoes and suits for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase the family’s cash flow and quality of life. In the future, Ruth plans to have her own clothing shop and see her grandchildren through their education.

properties.title: Damas Del Barrio San Antonio Group : Paraguay
properties.description: $1,875 of $2,900 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 5, 2011 The committee named “Damas del Barrio San Antonio” (Women of San Antonio Neighborhood) was started as a result of the efforts of Sra. Blanca. She organized her friends and neighbors and informed them about the Program of Women Entrepreneurs. They were happy to hear about the program and decided to organize a committee. There are currently 15 members in the committee. All of them work responsibly and in a cooperative manner. Their primary purpose is to generate more income to help their families and themselves. Sra. Deolinda has a small store that helps to sustain her family, provide for their daily needs, and give her children the minimum necessities to have a decent life. Someday she hopes to expand her business so that she can generate more income. She is requesting a loan to buy food products, canned goods, meats, and other items to restock her store.

properties.title: Oscar Martin Purizaca Rivas : Peru
properties.description: $250 of $1,100 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 1, 2011 Oscar is 47 years old and lives in his own home together with his wife and dependent children. His home is located in the rural area of Lambayeque district. He lives in a small, developing community whose people are entrepreneurial. Oscar provides a public transport service in a vehicle that he hires every day. He has been doing this for more than 15 years. This business activity has allowed Oscar to provide his children with food and an education. In spite of the difficulties, he feels confident that one day his situation will change. Oscar is requesting a loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which he will use to make some repairs to his home so that he can provide his family with a better quality of life. He would be extremely grateful to receive the loan as these repairs are much needed. Oscar is a long-standing client of our institution and he has repaid all his previous loans properly.

properties.title: Anonymous : Sierra Leone
properties.description: $825 of $1,200 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 20, 2011 This lady is a 40-year-old businesswoman. She is married and has one child. In 1998, she established her assorted pans, dishes, and cooking utensils business. She began her business in order to help her husband support their family. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. She requires a loan in order to buy more pans, dishes, and cooking utensils by the carton. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, she plans to buy a motor vehicle and educate her child. She thanks you for your support.

properties.title: Jalal Atayev : Azerbaijan
properties.description: $100 of $1,275 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 21, 2011 Jalal is married and has two children that he is very proud of since they are struggling to get ahead. He started a business of processing and selling food and vegetables 7 years ago. He is experienced in this kind of business and that allows him to expand his clientele day by day. Right now Jalal requests 1,000 AZN for purchasing more food to further process and to sell. With your help, Jalal will be able to feel proud that through much effort, his children went to college and became honorable people.

properties.title: Ana Cenobia Castilla Quiróz : Colombia
properties.description: $625 of $1,125 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 24, 2011 Ana, 48, is a very enterprising woman. She lives in the Los Altos del Bosque neighborhood of the city of Cartagena with her husband and three children aged 22 to 26. She dreams that her children may fulfill their own dreams. They are her inspiration in the independent work she does, in which she makes clothing, especially women's clothing. She began her work looking for an income opportunity to support her husband's leadership in their home, without neglecting the education and upbringing of her children. This was the reason she went to school to study dressmaking, by which means she would achieve her two objectives. Finally she started up her venture, beginning with a dressmaking shop in her own home. Gradually her business has grown and she plans to continue to develop it to the point at which it may generate some jobs for others. Her Kiva loan is the first financing Ana has had with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase cloth, thread, buttons and a semi-industrial overlock sewing machine. With these she will evaluate her productive task, improve process times, and finally, respond quickly to orders for new designs in the feminine line.

properties.title: Herbert : Uganda
properties.description: $350 of $600 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 4, 2011 Herbert is a hardworking 25 year-old living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda with a dream of building his own house one day. He has been in the water fitting business for two years now. He got his initial capital from his wages working for others in a similar business. His desire is to own a water company. Herbert intends to use the loan to purchase water fitting equipment for resale purposes.

properties.title: Adjo : Togo
properties.description: $100 of $450 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 5, 2011 Unmarried and without children, Adjo is 36 years old and is a hairstylist by profession. Alongside her main business, Adjo sells juice and water in packets and in frozen form. She began this activity in 2008 and is seeking a new loan through us to better establish her business by supplying herself with sugar, flavourings, and also purified water. Adjo is an active young woman of good character.

properties.title: Minara Usupova's Group : Kyrgyzstan
properties.description: $575 of $1,000 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 6, 2011 Minara is the leader of this group. She is 41 and married to a bus driver. Together with her husband she is raising three daughters and a son. The oldest daughter studies at college, and the other children are at school. In order to earn additional money to meet the family’s needs, Minara breeds and resells farm animals. She also has a farm. With money received from a loan Minara wants to purchase additional cattle for breeding. In the future she wants to save money to purchase an apartment in Bishkek, the capital of Kyrgyzstan. About MCC Mol Bulak Finance LLC:

properties.title: Saresouna Group : Senegal
properties.description: $250 of $4,125 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 1, 2011 This group was created on July 12, 2008. It comprises 40 women who all live in the same town. They all have small-scale businesses. Moumini (standing second from the right toward the left) is the group’s official. She is 39 years old and married, plus she has eleven family members to support. Moumini sells condiments, sugar, and tea. This is a business she has been operating for two years. Her new loan will enable her to stock up on tea and sugar to be sold. The profits from this business will allow her to purchase resale items and various merchandise for her shop.

properties.title: Sam Soom Group : Bolivia
properties.description: $1,025 of $2,300 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 22, 2011 This is a new community bank, but with two senior members, it is comprised of eight people. The majority of the women live in the Tembladerani zone. They sell CDs and cellular accessories. Others sell high end clothes that are well known in the group. There are also two men who live in the same area. The president's name is Shirley. She sells CDs, and her locale is on a central avenue that goes through the city of La Paz. She is established and very responsible. She has been working in this business for two years. The money from the loan will be used to CDs with music and children's movies since the school holiday has started and there is a lot of demand for these children's movies. Shirley is a young, hardworking person. She is grateful to this organization for the help it provides.

properties.title: Andriy Rochnyak : Ukraine
properties.description: $1,775 of $2,025 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 20, 2011 Andriy is married with a teenage son and a daughter. He and his family live in Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine. Andriy offers transportation services on the territory of Ukraine. He has been working in this business sphere for four years. Currently, his monthly net profit amounts to 5,500 Grivnyas. Andriy is requesting a 16,000 Grivnya loan to do major repairs on his vehicle engine, as well as to purchase four tires and an accumulator unit for his car. Andriy’s enterprise is the main source of income for his family of four. He is working hard hoping to ensure a decent living for his children. One of Andriy’s biggest dreams is to help his children through college thus giving them a chance to become educated people and get a better life.

properties.title: Ligia Del Socorro Blandon Guevara : Nicaragua
properties.description: $275 of $450 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 23, 2011 Ligia lives in the Ticuantepe municipality with her husband and children. Her future plans are to be able to provide them with better living conditions, and to support their education so that they can become professionals. Ligia used her previous loans to invest in her clothing business. Now, she wants to improve her home. She will build a partition and plaster it. She is grateful to Afodenic and the Kiva funds. She is grateful for the trust shown in her so that she will be able to make her dreams come true. She has scarce resources, and she is not able to buy all of the construction materials at once.

properties.title: Amal Shanti : Palestine
properties.description: $550 of $1,000 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 22, 2011 Amal has a big family of three daughters and two sons. Amal and her husband work together in their clothing store selling clothes for all ages. They need to pay for the new summer clothes they are buying, but the money they have is not enough, so they took out a loan from FATEN to make up the difference. Amal is a conservative woman therefore her husband is photographed instead.

properties.title: Rahmattilo Muratov : Tajikistan
properties.description: $225 of $3,000 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 24, 2011 Rahmattilo lives in the Shahrituz region. He's fifty-four years of age, married and has three children. They own a large plot of land adjacent to their home, where they have grown vegetables and melons for the past twenty-one years. He's asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizers, fuel and watermelon seeds. It's watermelon planting season, so Rahmattilo is requesting a loan in order to plant and receive a good harvest fro sale.

properties.title: Yasmeen's Group : Pakistan
properties.description: $725 of $1,075 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 28, 2011 Yasmeen is 45 years old and married with six children. All of her children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. A caring lady, Yasmeen prefers staying at home and doing her household responsibilities. She takes care of her family and makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to them by fulfilling their needs. Her husband runs a grocery store in the market where he sells daily household items such as cooking oil, spices, lentils etc. to his clients at reasonable rates. People prefer his store over any other because of his good behavior and quality items for sale. Yasmeen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to further expand their grocery store business. With the loan, her husband will put more groceries into his store for sale. He has been running this store for the past 8 years and Yasmeen is hopeful that the loan investment will be proved beneficial for him and raise their family’s living standard. Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Yasmeen.

properties.title: Saint Christophe Group : Senegal
properties.description: $1,950 of $3,175 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 1, 2011 The borrowing group Saint Christophe was created on May 11, 2010. It consists of 21 members from the same area. Their main activity is business. Mrs. Mariame in the red scarf at the far right of the photo is the group leader. She is 24 years old, married, and mother of 2 children. Her main business is the sale of palm oil. She has solid experience in this activity after having done it for several years. Her loan will allow her to buy sufficient quantities of palm oil to meet her customers' demand. Her goal is to buy a house and contribute to the family expenses: food, children’s schooling.

properties.title: Hézouwè : Togo
properties.description: $350 of $550 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 5, 2011 Married to an accountant and the mother of three children, Hézouwè is 28 and she lives in Agoé with her spouse. In 2010, she opened a shop in her home where she sells staple goods (sugar, rice, etc.). She would like to see her children grow up in good conditions. This first loan will help her to buy foodstuffs to respond to the demand of her numerous customers. She buys her goods at the market in Lomé. She makes lemon juice with hibiscus (flavoring).

properties.title: Siham : Palestine
properties.description: $300 of $900 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 8, 2011 Siham, who is photographed with her husband in the picture here in FATEN's branch in Hebron, is a 48-year-old mother of five daughters and four sons. Two of her sons are construction workers and the rest are young school students. Siham and her husband run a goat farm in the village of Bani Nuiem in Hebron. They raise and sell goats, Siham came to FATEN to take a $900 loan to purchase more goats and increase their dairy products, which will increase the farm's sales and improve the family's income. Bani Nuiem is famous for raising cattle and dairy products.

properties.title: Jose Elmo Becerra Sanchez : Peru
properties.description: $550 of $750 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 1, 2011 Elmo is 43 years old, a hard-working man who lives with his wife and three minor children in the district of Guadalupe in Pacasmayo – La Libertad. Elmo and his family have a good quality of life and stability. Elmo dedicates himself to auto body repair and painting, and has a great amount of experience in this line of work. Elmo has an established customer base, and feels satisfied with the demand his service generates. Elmo wants to invest into the purchase of acrylic paints and other tools of the trade that he needs. He has a business plan to prosper in his activity. Elmo requests a loan of 2000 new Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to reach his goals. He would be extremely grateful for being granted the loan, as it would be very useful to him. Elmo is an entrepreneurial and hard-working man who has worked with our entity and adequately made his payments.

properties.title: Joe-Ann Barrientos : Philippines
properties.description: $225 of $1,175 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 7, 2011 Joe-ann is 41 years old and lives in Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental Philippines. She is happily married and a mother of six school-aged children. Joe-ann owns and operates a food business to earn a living. She has a small bakery that sells different kinds of bread, pastries and cakes. Besides the food stall, she sells additional items like rice, corn and feed. She has been engaged in this type of business for three years with a monthly income of PHP 5,000. Joe-ann requested a loan of PHP 50,000 at GDMPC to buy building materials too expand her food stall. Joe-ann has been member of GDMPC for more than 10 years. In the future, Joe-ann hopes to expand her business and gain more profits.

properties.title: Handmaa Peljee : Mongolia
properties.description: $925 of $1,200 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 30, 2011 Handmaa is 49 years old and lives with her son in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Songinohairhan district in Mongolia. Her son is a student who manages a taxi service in his spare time. Handmaa runs a grocery store in a rented stall at a trading center. She started her business in 2008 and is planning to expand her business. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for her business. She is an honest woman who says, "I want to receive a loan to expand and continue my business."

properties.title: Javid Shikhiyev : Azerbaijan
properties.description: $1,075 of $1,275 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 13, 2011 Javid owns a small kiosk and sells magazines, newspapers and office supplies in Sabirabad city. He started this business 5 years ago. The goods he sells are in high demand and his business is going well. He is married and has 2 adorable children who are going to school. Javid is a hard-working person and he would like to develop his business even more. His spouse is a housewife and sometimes helps Javid with his business. This kiosk is the only source of income in his family. Javid would like to get a loan of 1,000 AZN to increase his inventory. He hopes that this loan will be next step in his business growth. Javid 's goal is to have a stable source of income for his family.

properties.title: Anonymous : Lebanon
properties.description: $800 of $1,200 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 10, 2011 This Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and two siblings. He has owned a small grocery store since 2009. He sells all types of food products, juices, soft drinks, breads etc. His shop is situated in a busy area so there are a good number of customers passing by. He helps his father with the household expenses. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 US from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his store’s inventory. He expects that his business will continue to grow with the coming years.

properties.title: Arouna Diarra : Mali
properties.description: $575 of $675 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 1, 2011 Mr. AROUNA is a 39 year old man who lives with his spouse and six children in an nuclear family in SANANKOROBA, one of the sub-prefectures of the prefecture of KATI, in the second largest administrative region of Mali. Due to life difficulties, AROUNA left school very early to start a small business of selling sundries for more than three years. With the savings generated by this activity, he started a business of buying and selling fuel, lubricants, etc. Nowadays, he has a store selling fuel and lubricants, which are very popular. He is on his second loan with Soro Yiriwaso, after fully repaying his first loan. He plans to have, with this second loan, 600 liters of different types of lubricant. He stocks up in Bamako, once a month. He sells mainly retail and for cash to a diverse and varied clientele. He hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 65,000 FCFA that will allow him to make loan payments and invest the rest in his business.

properties.title: Stephen Nabibya Leo Javan : Kenya
properties.description: $300 of $800 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 20, 2011 Stephen is a businessman who operates a (bodaboda) motorbike transportation business to earn a living. He has been in the business for four years. Previously, Stephen was employed. He works hard in his business to educate and provide for his seven-year-old child. Through Faulu Kenya, he has been trained in financial management, which has helped him to plan his finances. He hopes to grow his business ten times in five years. He has requested for 70,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a new motorbike.

properties.title: Tamara Chirkina : Ukraine
properties.description: $825 of $1,900 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 20, 2011 Tamara is married with two grown children. She lives and works in her home town of Melitopol. Tamara runs a women's clothing sales business in a local marketplace called ‘Rizhskyi'. She started her venture 15 years ago. Presently, Tamara has about 20,000 grivnyas in working capital. Her profit amounts to 7,000 grivnyas. Tamara is seeking a 15,000 grivnya loan to re-stock her seasonal merchandise and add a variety of light and trendy blouses and tees to her selection of women's outer clothing. Tamara is an experienced entrepreneur who is always diligent in her work and payments. Tamara is planning to use the generated income for personal needs: she is hoping to purchase new home electronic appliances for the family.

properties.title: Shomurod Shoimov : Tajikistan
properties.description: $1,275 of $1,725 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 21, 2011 Shomurod lives in Shahrituz. He is 69 years old, married, and has four children. His son left for Russia to work. Shomurod has been working as a herdsman for more than twelve years. He primarily makes money breeding cattle. He is taking out a loan to buy cattle to expand his herd. Шомурод проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 69 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Его сын уехал в России на заработки. Сам Шомурод более 12 лет занимается животноводством. Он в основном зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.

properties.title: Dios Bendice 3, 4 & 5 Group : Dominican Republic
properties.description: $3,800 of $4,825 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 29, 2011 Margarita is one of the members of the “Dios Bendice” (God Bless) 3, 4 & 5 group which has 15 micro-businesswomen. They are involved in clothing sales, natural products sales, shoe sales, food sales, etc. Margarita lives in the city of La Romana. Its economy depends on tourism and the sugarcane industry. It also has a sizable population of Dominicans and Haitian immigrants who live in communities with very limited resources. Margarita is very excited to receive her third loan from Esperanza Internacional, having satisfactorily repaid her previous loan and taken an important step in her business’ growth. She has had her business for about four years; she started it with some savings her husband had. He gave them to her to start up her business. She is running a candy shop stall, and she is planning on investing the new loan in buying snacks, juices, candies, gums, and many other products. She sells them by walking around and waiting for various schools to get out. Margarita’s family is made up of herself, her long-term partner and their five children. She tells us that her greatest challenge is to have her own house. She really enjoys working and attending church. She will use her profits to invest in her business and to start building her house, little by little and with some help from her long-term partner.

properties.title: Galina Govzan : Ukraine
properties.description: $2,150 of $2,525 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 1, 2011 Galina got married not so long ago. Her husband's name is Roman. Galina worked as a manager after graduating from the university, but has left her job because of small wages. She went to work with her mother in the ritual shop and within the last year the business operations were completely transferred to her. Right now this business is the main source of income for the family. Galina is hardworking and purposeful. Her business goal is to open a second location with similar products. Galina is asking to give her a loan in the amount of 20,000 hrivnas to buy products (coffins, name plates, ritual clothing) and raw materials for making of wreaths. She can increase the variety and so the customer base will increase too as well as the income for the family.

properties.title: Mivado Group : Benin
properties.description: $825 of $875 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 1, 2011 MIVADO is a group made up of three persons whose president (the one with her hand raised in the photo) is called Agnès. The members of the group live in the same neighborhood in Bénin. In order to increase their working capital, this group is requesting, for the fourth time, a loan from ALIDé. Agnès was born in 1970 in Bénin and is married to Bonaventure, a chauffeur. The couple have three children, all enrolled in school and living under their roof. Agnès never attended school. In order to support herself and her family, Agnès sells « Akassa » (a dough made from maize flour). She has been in this business for almost four years, and it allows her, together with her husband, to cover the various expenses of the family. Agnès buys her supplies in a town in Bénin. This fourth loan will certainly permit Agnès and her group to raise the level of their businesses and grow their clientele and their income.

properties.title: Jaime Andrés Tamayo Rengifo : Colombia
properties.description: $1,075 of $1,125 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 3, 2011 When Jaime Andrés, 29, became unemployed, he decided to create a business of his own: a food stand located in the Rionegro residential area in east Antioquia which is where he’s from. Together with a friend they rented a food cart which needs to have some adjustments made. He also needs to buy the ingredients necessary to start generating his own income and improve his quality of life. In the future, Jaime Andrés dreams with having his own locales in various parts of the municipality as well as with creating jobs.

properties.title: Yean Neang : Cambodia
properties.description: $875 of $1,000 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 8, 2011 Yean, 57 years old, is farmer who also raises animals. Her husband is a rice seller and a fisherman. Their income is $9 per day. They have four children. Two are working in the factory and can make $8 per day for their income. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $10 on electricity, and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a stock of rice for her husband to sell. Her husband has two careers, some time he go fishing but he sell rice is more often. His business is very successful as he is a good and honest man, so he can get a lot of costumers to buy his rice. Her husband has not yet made a plan to extend the business because he needs to survey the economic situation in his village and others. She plans to repair her house when she can make more profit.

properties.title: Joseph : Rwanda
properties.description: $800 of $850 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 1, 2011 Joseph is 30 years old and married. He started a business three years ago selling various goods such as clothes, biscuits, sugar, lotion, soap, etc. Joseph works from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day. Joseph has requested his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy the above-mentioned goods to sell. He will use the profit generated from this loan to reinvest in his business and to buy a motorcycle to help him.

properties.title: Nyam-Erdene Munkhdalai : Mongolia
properties.description: $1,550 of $2,875 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 2, 2011 Nyam-Erdene is a bright young man who is trying hard to achieve great success in his life. He operates computer services business at a rented space in an indoor local market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He lives with his wife and 3-year-old son in a ger (a traditional Mongolian felt tent) in the outer ger districts of Ulaanbaatar. His wife works as a designer at a private company and his son goes to kindergarten. Nyam-Erdene offers services such as copying, scanning, printing, and photo printing on mugs/cups, as well as other computer maintenance services. He owns 4,200,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) worth of equipments and machines at his office. He is requesting a 3,600,000 MNT loan to purchase additional photo sticker and mug printing machines. As he is usually overloaded with printing orders, he wants to buy one more of these machines with the intention of increasing the productivity of his work. Nyam-Erdene has been running his business for more than four years, hence he is quite experienced. His goal is to establish his own company in the future and improve the living standards of his family.

properties.title: Sevindj Mammadova : Azerbaijan
properties.description: $2,400 of $2,550 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 4, 2011 Sevindj was born in 1974. She is married and has two children. Sevindj has raised poultry for nine years. She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person). She is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with her family. Now she needs 2000 AZN to buy chickens and ducks to increase the number of birds she sells.

properties.title: Anonymous : Lebanon
properties.description: $825 of $1,000 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 10, 2011 This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single Lebanese man. He is living with his parents and two siblings. Despite his young age, he has been working as a mechanic since 2009. His work consists of performing maintenance on all types of cars. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1000 US from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a car in order to be able to satisfy his customer's demands by serving them whenever their cars are damaged. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring him positive growth.

properties.title: Mariana Rebeca Pena Estrella : Ecuador
properties.description: $575 of $1,000 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 5, 2011 Mariana Rebeca is 20 years old. She’s single living with her parents in Guaranda Canton, Bolívar Province. She does not have children. The members of the “Bellavista” communal bank are located in the community of Papauco Pucara, Guanujo Parish. Guaranda Canton is 15 minutes away from the Cooperative’s office. The communal bank has 11 members who farm, raise animals and do other activities. Mariana is a potato, wheat and corn farmer and also has three head of cattle. Her purchases are done in the Guaranda market and sales take place in that same city’s wholesale market. She is asking for the loan to buy supplies and animal feed. Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs. The challenges she faces are plagues and animal illnesses. Her dream is to build a house. She enjoys playing with her siblings, nieces and nephews.

properties.title: Dima : Togo
properties.description: $650 of $800 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 25, 2011 A young lady of 33 years, Dima buys yams in Anie and resells them in a local market. She has two children and her husband is a reseller. She also sells plates and canned food. She wants to stock more goods to better meet customer demand.

properties.title: Fe Morales : Philippines
properties.description: $275 of $475 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 7, 2011 Fe is 43 years old and lives in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a good mother of six children. Fe has been operating a retail shop that sells different kinds of food. She sells canned goods, biscuits, candies and chocolates. She has been engaged in this type of business for 20 years. She earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 from GDMPC to purchase additional stock to sell. Fe has been member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Fe hopes to gain more profit and expand her business.

properties.title: Felismina Mavume : Mozambique
properties.description: $300 of $375 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 3, 2011 Felismina was born in the district of Marracuene in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique. She is married and the mother of 7 children whose respective ages she she doesn't remember, only that they're all adults. She did not go to school. She lives in her own home with her family and also supports her grandchildren that live with her. She never left Marracuene. She has had a business for more than 22 years. She makes 24,000 meticals a month, which she puts towards her home's expenses. She also saves some in her bank account at the BIM bank. She has never had a loan with another bank. She became familiar with Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is her first loan in the amount of 10,000 meticals, which she will use to buy construction materials (stone, cement, iron, bricks, sand, etc.). Her dream is to finish her home and to furnish it to provide more comfort to her family. She plans on requesting more loans from Hluvuku to do this.

properties.title: Ana Gonzalez : Paraguay
properties.description: $575 of $600 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 26, 2011 Ana is 48 years old, married, and lives in her own home in the city of Caacupe. Ana describes herself as a very hard-working and tenacious woman. She has a grocery store in her home and has an established customer base as she has been in this business for many years. Ana dreams of owning a store full of a wide range of products where she can meet all her customers' needs. Ana is requesting a loan from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva so that she can buy meat with which to fulfil her customer demand. With the remaining money, she will buy an awning that will protect her customers from the sun and the rain. This will enable her to make more income for her family. In the future, she would like to continue working with Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva so that she can continue growing every day and support her family.

properties.title: Maina Ololoigero : Kenya
properties.description: $200 of $450 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 26, 2011 Maina is 26 years old. He is married and supports three people. He is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last three years. He learned about KADET from credit officers. This will be his first loan which he is planning to spend to purchase farm inputs. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming. His dream is do large-scale farming and attain financial independence. He is a hard-working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

properties.title: Oscar Rolando : Bolivia
properties.description: $300 of $1,000 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 18, 2011 Rolando lives in the department of Cochabamba in Cercado province. He has been separated from his wife for 3 years. They had problems and so separated. Upon their separation he decided to leave everything to his wife and not ask for anything for himself because she was left with one of their children. He went back to live with his mother, who is 89 years old, and now he is starting all over again. He requests a loan so that he can buy computers and in this way start up a new business. With this business he will be able to support his mother and show that he can once again move forward with his life.

properties.title: Nseenya Zinnunula Omunaku Group : Uganda
properties.description: $2,750 of $4,725 raised. Started raising funds on Jun 29, 2011 40 year old Emmanuel is now 20 years in his farming business in Lugazi. The happily married father of 8 says its been a worthwhile business venture due to the high demand for food in many parts of Lugazi which is usually dry and where many indigenous people are not known for farming. He grows and sells foods such as bananas, cassava, groundnuts, sorghum, beans and maize. He also runs a retail shop as a supplementary business. He says his business generates him profits of shillings 500,000 per week. With this loan, Emmanuel says he is going to purchase better and higher grade manure for his farms.

properties.title: Dole Group : Senegal
properties.description: $1,700 of $2,675 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 1, 2011 The solidarity group was created on January 7, 1997. It is comprised of eight women who live in the same district. Their main work involves small-scale commerce. Ms. Aramata, who is at the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the group's official. She is 43 years old, married, and the mother of one child. She also supports three other children entrusted to her by her parents. She is active in selling vegetables. She has good experience in this business domain in which she has been working for several years. This loan will enable her to bolster her capital and to develop her business further. The profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions (food).

properties.title: Puca Puca Group : Peru
properties.description: $1,625 of $3,450 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 6, 2011 The Puca Puca community bank has started their sixth loan with 13 members who have a variety of businesses including the sale of grain, clothing, kebab, food, vegetables, meat and firewood. Others make a living in carpentry. Jesusa is the president for the current loan and she has a carpentry workshop. She will invest the requested loan into the purchase of wood, glue and nails. Jesusa works with the help of her son. They make tables, chairs, windows, wardrobes, pantries, banisters, etc. She has participated in FINCA Perú for the past four loans. She appreciates the ease with which she receives the loans, working with trust. She entered the group through an invitation from her sister, hesitantly at first, but now she is happy. Thanks to her savings and the loan she was able to buy a wood planning machine for her workshop. Now she is saving to purchase other machines.

properties.title: Cecilia Rosalia Moran Garcia : Ecuador
properties.description: $900 of $1,200 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 4, 2011 Cecilia Rosalia is 26 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos. The community bank VRC San Francisco de Sibimbe is located in the Sibimbe precinct in the Ventanas canton. It has 20 members who work in short cycle agriculture planting corn and rice. Cecilia works in agriculture and plants corn and rice. She makes purchases in Ventanas every month and sells them in the market in that same town. She is asking for this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides. The support of the loan will help her family financially meet this needs. Her dream is to continue with her work and have the income to give her children an education. In her free time, she spends time with her children and cleans the house.

properties.title: Oyunchimeg Batdorj : Mongolia
properties.description: $1,025 of $2,825 raised. Started raising funds on Jul 6, 2011 Mrs. Oyunchimeg, 52, sells car spare parts and runs an auto service that is called “Auto Standard” with her two sons. They live together in their own house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She is a divorcee and a hardworking woman who has been successfully running her business for the last two years. Now she is planning to expand her business by buying some car spare parts and accessories from abroad, especially China.
